author: {'steamid': '76561197995982646', 'num_games_owned': 4614, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 88, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1711795437}
review:
For reviews of Artifex Mundi hidden object games, I like to compare them to other games in their publishing line, assuming the reader knows as to what hidden object games are.

Eventide: Slavic Fable is an exciting adventure game inspired by Slavic mythology.

Set in a contemporary heritage park where mythical Slavic creatures co-exist with humans, the adventure begins when the protagonist, a famous botanist, receives an alarming invitation from her grandmother, the park's curator. The protagonist is tasked with saving an endangered plant, but this turns out to be the least of her concerns. Her Grandma is kidnapped by the mysterious Boruta, who is plotting to conquer and destroy the world using the park's ancient magic.

The protagonist must seek alliance with the creatures living in the park, in order to defeat the villain, save her Grandma, and prevent worldwide calamity. Will she be able to stop Boruta and his evil forces?"

Roaming through the areas this mythical setting has to offer, 38 beautiful, diverse locations have to be discovered, 43 challenges need to be completed. Accompanied with a captivating background story, all set in this wonderful setting.

Art style of the game is overall mediocre cartoony, compared to other AM HOG. Expect colorful, yet ominous background in which the game plays. Withchaotic, somewhat more blended backgrounds.All lot of variation is implemented throughout the entire game, with the backgrounds being beautiful enough to blend the game to a whole experience.Storywise, the game is not divided up into chapters, making it a more streamlined, railroad and rather short HOG. Hence, backtracking between several areas is not required as much, which keeps a good pace throughout the game.

The ambient sound effects and backgroundmusic blend in seamlessly with the graphics and gameplay, and add to the enjoyment. Background music can be repetitive, however,ranging from piano music to soothing roleplaying music. Whereas all dialogue is spoken. Animations are present in a more simplistic, static manner, but the lipping of the characters is done in a better way than previous AM installments.

There are very few standard hidden object scenes, with occasionally some combination objects in them, pretty standard as in previous AM games. Some objects, like the cards and flowers, found in the backgrounds are somewhat difficult to find and can be missed, since they have an achievement attached to them, beware achievement hunters. With the minigames, heck the entire game, being more on the easy side. Some of the games were very enjoyable however. In the second half of the game, more inventory items being to collect and it can become more unclear what to do next.

There is a bonus chapter included as well, which is not required to play to unlock all the achievements. The gameis, with only one playthroughof the base game required, to achieve a perfect game, excellently suited for achievement hunters and completionists. Three achievements are particularly easy to miss out on,two collection ones and the â€œBookwormâ€ achievement, which is notoriously hard. If you are gunning for a perfect game on the first playthrough, I recommend consulting a guide beforehand though, to make sure you do not miss out on the collection achievements and especially the â€œBookwormâ€ one. But the game can be perfected in one playthrough with using a guide easily. 25 achievements have to be unlocked to get a perfect game, easily done under 3 hours or less.

Overall, Eventide â€“ Slavic Fable, is a lower difficulty, very linear, shorter edition, compared to other installments of the Artifex Mundi publisher line. Developers â€œThe House of Fablesâ€ created a somewhat typical HOG, with fewer hidden object scenes, and some hidden objects integrated in the backgrounds. The Bookworm achievement made me play through the game 3 times, which was unnecessarily frustrating.

Recommended for: hidden object game lovers, achievement hunters, completionists& casual gamers.

Cheers,
SultanK

review:
Really fun point and click adventure â™¥ 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3138869530

I enjoyed this one, though I had to play it 2.5 times to get the achieves. Read all notes, play on hard setting, find all items. Good thing is if you play it and then play it a 2nd time, it'll remember what you collected before so you don't have to play the game all the way through unless it's the last note lol so look for that last note before you complete the game if you want achieves.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3138869779

Great adventure game. Interesting story and adventure.

Happy Gaming~!

Minigames kennt man bereits aus den anderen Spielen. Fast als wÃ¤ren sie eins zu eins Ã¼bernommen - nur ein wenig anders angemalt.   

Kann man spielen, gibt aber schÃ¶nere Spiele dieser Art. Dieses wirkt nicht sinnvoll durchdacht und teilweise unlogisch. Auch sind Umrisse von GegenstÃ¤nden zum Teil echt schrecklich. Was soll das sein? SpÃ¤ter: aha, da soll eine Muschel rein. Darauf muss man aber auch erstmal kommen, da der Umriss mit dem einer Muschel nicht viel gemein hat.  FÃ¼r ein paar Euro im Angebot kann man es mitnehmen, ansonsten meiner Meinung nach eher nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561199249239770', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1700819903}
review: ah, yes. another old-but-gold AM HOG. i no longer aim to 100% the achievements, tho i will say it is truly a great experience to remember this game. other than the rest of the ones i've played before and played again, the gameplay for this one seems pretty quick. nothing to say much about the puzzles, they weren't as difficult. the characters were pretty cute! extra story felt short but nonetheless, happy i got to play it. i might play the next slavic fable in a while. i'd definitely rate this game a [u]7/10[/u] for the experience and would still recommend to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1698998579}
review:
"Eventide: Slavic Fable" is a free mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as a lazy, cheap cash grab.  It's a routine mobile ported hidden object casual puzzle/adventure game with a historical/fantasy/mystery theme. Solving various puzzles and hidden object minigames progresses the plot and unravels the mystery. 

As with most mobile ported HOGs, there's a simplistic interface, locked/unchangeable screen resolution, next to no customisability, and somewhat low resolution graphical assets.  All of this puts this game below minimum standards for a contemporary PC game, and Artifex Mundi have been polluting Steam with these low effort mobile apps for years.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

There's no option to change the resolution and no useful graphics tweaks.  There's no way to ensure this is running at the native resolution of your display.  There's no guarantee this game will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.

The controls can't be customised because the game has such a dumbed down, simplified interface that it's just point and click stuff like a browser/Flash game.  The fact that the interface is this dumbed down might be seen as a problem in itself, however... this is a fairly shallow experience if you're the kind of gamer that likes to play games with deep, rich control schemes and interaction.  You'll get none of that here.

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Once more we see greedy mobile devs trying to scam PC gamers. On Steam, this is an eye watering $15 USD (You could get the entire Mass Effect Trilogy for the same price as this mobile app), on app stores, it's free. Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay FIFTEEN BUCKS FOR A FREE MOBILE APP just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam.  This is unacceptable disrespect for PC gamers.  Because this can be played free elsewhere, and because of the other defects, it's impossible to recommend.  Who do they think we are?

author: {'steamid': '76561198046362950', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1697414962}
review:
I love Artifex Mundi and HO games but I vastly prefer the list format scenes. This game hasn't had any of those so far and some of the actions to navigate the map and objectives between scenes have made less sense than the average Artifex Mundi HO - they all have a moment or three of questionable logic but this one seems to have a few more than the average.

But my biggest complaint comes down to a preference. This is one of their variations where they provide pictures or shape outlines of the things you're looking for. I'm all about the lists and this game hasn't had a list yet. I think it's a quality made AM HO, just not my preferred balance of puzzles to scenes or format mixture.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046835722', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1693733529}
review:
It's quite neat puzzle game with nice atmosphere. The character designs are somewhat bland and simple, but it doesn't bother too much. Game's soundtrack is relaxing, art beautiful and detailed. 
 
If you are experienced puzzler, I recommend to start with hardest difficulty level. I'm not too good of a player myself, yet the medium level felt mostly a bit too easy. 
 
I don't think this game has a replay value though, unfortunately. But worth to buy from sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071375554', 'num_games_owned': 2813, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1692032631}
review:
[h1]The whole fate of our Heritage Park is dependent on this plant[/h1]

The first game of the series Eventide, based on Slavic folklore, you play a famous botanist, Mary, who received a letter from her grandmother who rarely writes her, she knew it was urgent so she drove to the park which her family owns. On her way, she had an accident, a creature hit her car and someone saved her, only to find her grandmother being kidnapped by the same man who pretended to be on her side. Mary will try to help her grandmother and the ancient plant which she mentioned in the letter.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3020200686

There are few hidden object scenes, unlike what they mentioned on the store page. The puzzles are nice however, I found them enjoyable. What made me enjoy the game the most is the artwork, each area has some nice details and the choice of the color palette is beautiful. The soundtracks are nice as well, fitting the game's atmosphere. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3020200383

I found the voice-overs and conversations are weak compared to other HOGs, you feel no emotions from the characters, and they don't actually speak to each other, if you meet someone, the main character doesn't converse with them, instead, they keep answering things without a context. I found this a letdown.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3020201321

Pros:
+Beautiful visuals and location design.
+Good soundtracks.
+Good hidden objects scenes.
+Variety of puzzles.
+Collectables
+Fast traveling map.
+Steam achievements.

Cons
-Weak voice-overs and conversations. 

The bonus chapter was short and sweet, it tells the story of Mary's grandmother when she was young. I would recommend this game if you enjoy Slavic mythology, the collectible cards of the mythical Slavic creatures are a very interesting and good addition to the game. 

[i]Other Reviews:[/i]
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198071375554/recommended/510650?snr=1_5_9__402]Eventide 2: The Sorcerers Mirror Review[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198399810362', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1689628899}
review:
My first Artifex Mundi game! 

I chose this as my entrance because I love witchy botanical vibes, which it very much delivered on!

I didn't know anything really about Slavic mythology before going into this game so it was really interesting  delving into that for me. 

The puzzles were fun, a lot of hidden object puzzles as you'd expect, but also a few different types of puzzles- a few of which I got stuck on for a while! You can choose which difficulty you'd like at the start of the game - casual, advanced, or expert. I chose casual as I wasn't sure what to expect with this being my first Artifex Mundi game. I intend to go back and play the game on Expert to get the achievement and to see how it weighs against casual.

The cutscenes are....... hilarious. The animations are just so bad, but so bad that they're good again. But the static graphics are really pretty. The game gives you them as wallpapers too which is pretty neat! There's also some bonus content including a bonus adventure. This was a nice little story that revisted some of the locations with slight differences.

I streamed my playthrough to some friends so it became more of a group activity, which I very much recommend! It added more levels of fun and a touch of competition.

Overall, I definitely recommend this and will be going on to play the next games in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561199124289136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1704679375}
review: Great game! Nice graphics, cool lore and just a lot of fun. A definite thumbs up. Right after finishing the main story I went ahead and bought the bundle to complete the trilogy. Is it worth it at full price? Personally, I'd say no. But, that's mainly because I play them (100% them) and come back maybe a year later if I'm bored. But, if you are the type to enjoy these once in a while; Yes definitely.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198132995625', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1684080726}
review:
[h1] Eventide: Slavic Fable [/h1]
Hidden object game of 2016.

Is an adventure game inspired by Slavic legends. It is set in a modern open-air museum where mythical beings coexist with humans.
You have to save an endangered plant, but that soon turns out to be the least of your worries. Grandmother is kidnapped by Boruta, who wants to use the park's ancient magic powers to conquer and destroy the world.
So much for the content of the adventure. It doesn't sound that exciting at first, but it's told in an exciting way and implemented very well. Furthermore, it is handcrafted very well.

It often swarms here. Well made but very heavy. There is a help function. You can skip the minigames, but not all. However, they are moderate in terms of difficulty. There are some things that you have to make yourself, without help but with instructions.
The actual challenge in this game is the search for clues on how to proceed.
I've rarely used the help so often to find something.
The search is complex but rather easy.
Technically well implemented and error-free.
Clear tip for fans. It is the first of three thematically related games and I can also recommend it to beginners.
 
My group and my archive with over 5,450 reviews here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/hoi4deu

[h1] Eventide: Slavic Fable [/h1]
Wimmelbildspiel von 2016.

Ist ein von der slawischen Sagenwelt inspiriertes Adventure. Es spielt in einem modernen Freilichtmuseum, wo mythische Wesen neben den Menschen existieren.
Du musst eine gefÃ¤hrdete Pflanze retten, aber das stellst sich bald als die kleinste Sorge heraus. GroÃŸmutter wird von Boruta entfÃ¼hrt, der mithilfe der uralten ZauberkrÃ¤fte des Parks die Welt erobern und vernichten will.
Soweit zum Inhalt des Abenteuers. HÃ¶rt sich erstmal nicht so aufregend an, ist jedoch spannend erzÃ¤hlt und sehr gut umgesetzt. Desweiteren ist es Handwerklich sehr gut gemacht.

Es wimmelt hier des Ã¶fteren. Gut gemacht, aber sehr schwer. Es gibt eine Hilfefunktion. Die Minispiele kannst du Ã¼berspringen, aber nicht alle. Sind jedoch moderat, vom Schwierigkeitsgrad her. Es gibt einige Sachen die du selber Herstellen musst, ohne Hilfe aber mit Anleitung. 
Die eigentliche Herausforderung liegt bei diesem Game in der Suche nach Hinweisen wie es denn weiter geht.
Ich hab selten so oft die Hilfe genutzt um etwas zu finden.
Die Suche ist Komplex aber eher leicht.
Technisch gesehen gut umgesetzt und fehlerfrei. 
Klarer Tipp fÃ¼r Fans. Es ist das erste von drei thematisch zusammengehÃ¶rigen Spielen und ich kann es auch AnfÃ¤ngern empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158359741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1678753338}
review:
Started with the Enimagtics series, which led me to be a bit disappointed in this series in comparison. Some very exact clicking involved, solutions that don't make much logical sense, only really solvable by spam using objects in locations. 

Also, small pet peeve, someones been kidnapped and our character on multiple occasions stops all progress because she doesn't want to get webs on her hands.

Story was ok, nothing revolutionary. Hidden object games were good usually, and most puzzles were enjoyable.

Hoping the next in the series turns out better, but overall still a good time. I did manage to get jump scared by a child twice though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025000946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1675139801}
review:
This is middle of the way in the Mountain Crime Requital scale.

The art is beautiful (except for grandma's face...)  and I really like learning a little bit about Slavic Folklore. The story is nothing to write home about, but it was good enough accompaniment to the game as you went along. I liked the puzzles and had fun with the hidden object segments.

Some bits were a little disjointed and the character just knew things which sometimes made it hard to follow what steps the game wanted me to do next. Overall, still a fun time, definitely nab it, even better if you get it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256240230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1674762627}
review:
[h1] Eventide: Slavic Fable [/h1]

This is the first game in the innstallment of Eventide. The story where the protagonist must seek alliance with slavic creatures to save an endangered plant - the plant itself becomes secondary because her grandmother gets taken. The story takes place in an "slavic-creature-zoo-park-thing" - although I can appreciate the park og the background-art is beautiful - the game is kind of falling apart while playing - the bad guy is dull/tedious, the slavic creatures feels just forced in here and there. The story is fine (to some extent) but I do wish they would have told us more about the mythology of the creatures during the game (and not just on the cards that you collect along the way - feels a bit unatural to go to the homepage to read about them while playing). 

[h1] Pros [/h1]
- Nice background music that contribute to gameplay and story/mood
- Bonus chapter
- Map travel (kind of weird map - not always to a spesific scene more of an area - to be honest it's more annoying than helpful)
- Some variety in puzzles and games
- Adequte voice actors
- Beautiful art scenes 

[h1] Cons [/h1]
- Some of the characters feels a bit bad drawn (feels flat if that makes sense)
- It get's kind of borring, I just replayed it for acchievement - and it's not as enjoyable or entertaining to play this game again. 
- Bad map travel
- The theme has a lot of potencial but storywise and gameplaywise it just does not deliver. 
- Remember if you want the "bookworm" acchievement - remember to open the book in the last scene before finishing the game (I had to replay the whole thing for that which was very annoying)

All in all - I would buy it if it was on sale - but not to a full price. But I have to say there is a lot better games out there to try on if you enjoy this genre. I honestly don't know if I would reccommend this game or not - I feel a bit indifferent about it.

Anyways... Good luck and have fun - hope this was helpfull! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198867986436', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1673895261}
review: EstÃ©tica agradÃ¡vel. Sugiro guia para platinar. Recomendo acompanhar a histÃ³ria!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005057754', 'num_games_owned': 1275, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1673732272}
review:
I mean, if you've played any other House of Games/Artifex Mundi/hidden object games then you know how this one plays already.  Story won't be anything to write home about (but will still be charming and engrossing enough), art will be beautiful, puzzles will be easy enough, and hidden object scenes will be fun.

What makes this one special is the focus on Slavic folklore and mythology.  There's an attempt to shine a spotlight on the creatures that are NOT Baba Yaga or Leshy.  And they succeed fairly well.  That and character design that looks like something from a long-lost 1980's Jim Henson special.  That's honestly the main reason I keep coming back to this one.

So if you like Slavic mythology, obsessively collect hidden object games, and/or really miss Jim Henson, then I'd recommend [i]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198069885937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1673148076}
review: Started out fun, but about halfway through the game, you could tell the developers just wanted to be done. Instead of fun activities to help you find necessary items, they started using random HOGs. I say random becase unless you had hints on, you wouldn't know where to go to find them. You had to walk through the map to find the sparkles that would indicate something would happen there. Also, the firework caps you need at the end of the game are suddenly in Baba's cell when they weren't there before. Very lazy developing. Would have also been nice to know what Slavic creatures were featured in the game. Alas, they were never mentioned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198956299818', 'num_games_owned': 2010, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1672811883}
review: This is a very beautiful hidden object game. You need to complete the game in expert mode and you cannot use any hints or skip anything. This makes the game quite difficult, however there are multiple guides if you were to get stuck at any point. Takes about 3 hours to complete and unlock all the achievements. Make sure to collect all the cards, flowers and to read all the notes and speak to everyone. Everything in this game has an achievement so make sure not to miss anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561199155631677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1652910493}
review:
I don't remember anything unusual in this game, but the game was pretty good. Relaxing. Graphics are not bad. Plot is not bad too. Although I didnâ€™t much like this setting (of Slavic fairy tales). Riddles are standard for the games of this company, perhaps sometimes primitive.
The game is pretty short. With quite [spoiler]happy[/spoiler] ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095263665', 'num_games_owned': 555, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1670748238}
review:
Eventide: Slavic Fable is a hidden object game by The House of Fables, who I can probably say is my favorite HOG developer in terms of artstyle, as they made really pretty ones. At first I didn't really pay attention to this title since it seems a bit generic, but I eventually gave in and didn't regret it. The story might not be something very special and memorable, but its still pretty fun, and the beautiful artwork helps.

You play as a botanist named Mary, who is visiting her grandma, the curator of a Slavic-themed heritage park to save the endangered fern flower. But she is then kidnapped, and its up to Mary to save her grandma and the flower. You will encounter creatures from Eastern European folklore, both good and bad. There's also some collectible cards that unlocks a bit of trivia about them, even creatures who don't appear in the game. 

After you finish the game there's a bonus adventure where you play as Grandma when she was young, set in the same park, even using the same locations, but different as it was in a more pristine state. It's interesting to draw comparison between the two timelines. I think Eventide: Slavic Fable is a pretty good HOG, with beautiful artwork which is a very strong point in my opinion. You might find this game more interesting and relatable if you're Eastern European or familiar with its folklore, or if you're into learning new folklore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085858209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1670004610}
review:
While not developed by Artifex Mundi, this is still a very good HOG! There isn't really anything negative to say about it, honestly, and I enjoyed both the main story and the bonus chapter.

Hidden Object Puzzles: 4.5/5
Sometimes items were a tad bit difficult to find due to how closely they matched the colors of their environment but it wasn't a major issue.

Other Puzzles: 5/5
They ranged from easy to moderately difficult. Nothing was ridiculously easy or unnecessarily complicated, either. The puzzles all made sense to the story for the most part and were a nice addition to the HOGs.

Soundtrack: 5/5
Very beautiful soundtrack! Mystical and enchanting without being cheesy or over-the-top.

Graphics: 4/5
The animations for characters were a little awkward at times, and some proportions were messed up depending on what a particular character was doing. But it wasn't anything terrible. The forest environments were very lovely, though.

Story: 5/5
Both the main story and the bonus chapter were well-written. Good pacing, everything made sense, the characters were quite memorable (especially the Slavic critters). I never got bored nor did I ever find anything confusing or laughably ridiculous.

Voice Acting: 4.5/5
For the most part, very good. Some lines were delivered a little bit flat but they didn't have a major impact on the quality of the game or my enjoyment of it,

Overall rating: 93% 
Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042771493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1667794208}
review:
This is also one I like. I like that it's a kind of folklore that's not commonly featured here in games and movies / TV here. It's also one of the best series for continuing to follow the same character through each game.

I had no technical issues with the game. There are collectibles and a bonus adventure, so lots to collect and do, maybe even 2 playthroughs if you missed one like I did.

I think my only gripes are that there's no indicator in the HUD for collectibles like other games like this have, and that one of the achievements is to beat the game on expert mode. Expert mode isn't really that much harder, but I play on a tablet and not having the shimmering hidden object puzzles is kind of a pain because it's not super obvious when you have to take a second run at one you've already done, or to find some of them in the first place just by touch and without the cursor hints.

review:
Hello good people and evil ones and H.O.G. players and altogether combined!  This is a game where you find things and do things with them.  You also learn about Slavic mythological creatures and don't forget the most important one: Drowners smoke pipes.  They gotta get their stress out somehow.

Lilacus is freaking adorable.  He looks better as a creature than a kid.  The hogs are cute...  The bear is cute...  Everything is cute, even the goat dude wizzy!

Fun oh fun oh fun oh fun and fun and fun again!  Thank you!  :d =) :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198072002990', 'num_games_owned': 1618, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1657447498}
review: Another adorable Artifex Mundi game! Short and thankfully one that you can play through just the one time if you take your time and keep an eye out!! The puzzles were pretty easy and I wasn't stumped too often.. Super relaxing point and click game with a cool story and graphics!

author: {'steamid': '76561198083619079', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1654820497}
review:
Pros: Static scene art is lovely, setting is cool, game is the right kind of length (roughly 3 hours)

Cons: Animation and characters don't look so good, music is nice but not enough of it so it gets repetitive

Overall definitely worth a few pounds, it was a nice relaxing alternative to the more action heavy games I normally play.

author: {'steamid': '76561199141232563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1653755331}
review: I found it quite boring and tedious. The atmosphere and lore was nice but going back and forth all the time to get pieces and objects all the time got very dull and I discovered I'm not in to hidden objects tasks at all, if you are than it might be a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835430528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1652597430}
review:
An average hidden object game that is animated and voice acted.

Everything about this game is average, including sounds, music, graphics, puzzles, animation, and story.

The only outstanding feature is the deck of collectible cards that give a glimpse into slavic mythology.

All in all it is an easy game, optimal for beginners.

Tip: if you are going for collectibles, make sure that you have checked the whole location before picking up the items or solving puzzles because many scenes cannot be revisited later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125215874', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1652542032}
review:
Yet Another interesting HO game

Pros:
1) Interesting story
2) With interesting lore,and characters
3) Collectibles card actually had a purpose which is to tell some backstory
4) An ok-ish amount of Achievements
5) Totally 100% able
6) Good system where it will count if you meet the requirements ( flower, cards, reader)
7) Not so high challenging puzzles/ minigames ( guess it's a pros to me)

Cons:
1) Grapchis, CGI, Cinematics can be MEH
2) Dialogue are ... Heh, you know this kind of games

In conclusion, Around 6 hours for a 100% game, could be shorter if you did not be like an idiot like me to switch the difficulty on the 2nd playthrough, I only managed to get that "Expert Gamer" on the 3rd playthrough 8/10 Especially during a huge sale

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1652309510}
review:
I consider this to be an average, run-of-the-mill hidden object adventure game.  Nothing stood out to me about it compared to other games I've played in this sub-genre.  Everything works fine and it was a nice, casual experience.

There were some times I got stuck because of particularly obscure objects or interactions.  The hint system is the solution to getting stuck, but I was trying to do an Expert run so I refused to ask for any hints.

Now I go into Eventide 2, hoping they did something more unique and interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076876070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1651798567}
review: TECHNICALLY, this may be the only hidden item game that doesn't have an oil can.  Pretty darn close, but it's not technically the oil can in every other game.  I have peace now.

author: {'steamid': '76561199158292051', 'num_games_owned': 2792, 'num_reviews': 1619, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1646557010}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030546687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1644106381}
review:
There are better Artifex Mundi games out there, like the Enigmatis or Nightmares from the Deep trilogies.
This one has poor voice acting, simple story and annoying pre-requisites for progress (I've never used the Hint button this often before - some objects/areas unlock in illogical order).

author: {'steamid': '76561197960435705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1644071378}
review:
Poorly written, over contrived and badly designed.

I got this very cheaply and still feel hard done by. I just wanted a nice little hidden object game, which this is not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337071802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1680635682}
review: A large variety of puzzles and hidden object games.  Several types of each to make it interesting.  The game isn't short either.   Good value for your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198799761861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1643244382}
review: This was an interesting one. Overall I did really enjoy it, the drawings were pretty and it was fun to be in the world (as is usual for Artifex Mundi). However there were bits that were...odd? As others said, the overemphasis on SLAVIC constantly was weird (why would the creatures themselves say they were from Slavic myth rather than just...myth?) and the animated cutscenes were very strange looking, in a way that had my laughing out loud at times. Don't get me wrong, I had a good time, it's just...not the best one out there for sure, lol. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037426629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1643243112}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979693740', 'num_games_owned': 5710, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1641414409}
review:
Fun!  A challenge on expert with a surprisingly-long runtime (about 4-5 hours) compared to other HOGs.  I can't remember if I've played a House of Fables game before, but this one won me over for them despite the inclusion of a (very simplified) Hungarian ring puzzle.

They did some really cool things compared to other developers under the Mundi umbrella, too.  Given that this game is about Slavic myth (I assume they're not making all of this up), you can collect a bunch of cards throughout the game that can be viewed in the extras for more historical information about each creature and I love that kinda thing.  They also designed the game in a forwardly way in that you'll often encounter inventory items that you won't use until much later.  For example, there's the typical "collect 3 tokens" thing, but you might be hanging onto just one of them for an hour before you even see the next one, despite coming across the lock that requires them far earlier.  In most HOGs, you collect your stuff, use it, then move on.  This one felt far less on rails and added to the challenge of figuring out just what to do next.

It won't blow your mind, of course, but if you've been through all of AM's first-party games, I think House of Fables is a fine choice for a follow-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218305873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1638624436}
review:
Ich kann mich nicht dazu entschlieÃŸen, das Spiel negativ zu bewerten, da es allgemein ein sehr schÃ¶n gemachtes Spiel ist und ich niemanden davon abhalten will es zu kaufen. 
Die Szenarien sind gut gemacht, die Bilder toll, die Informationskarten Ã¼ber die slawischen Kreaturen haben mir sehr gefallen und die Story war nett - nichts Aufregendes, aber das erwate ich auch nicht bei einem Wimmelbildspiel.

Die GrÃ¼nde warum ich etwas mir gerungen habe, dieses Spiel positiv zu bewerten: Es ist sehr leicht. Und sehr sehr schnell durch.
In meinen 4 Spielstunden ist das Bonuskapitel mit drinnen + einmal nach 30 Minuten komplett neu anfangen, weil ich gesehen habe dass es eine Errungenschaft gibt wenn man es im Expertenmodus durchspielt. Das Hauptgame habe ich im Expertenmodus nach ca. 2-2,5h durch gehabt. Es war viel zu leicht, kein RÃ¤tsel war kniffelig und es gab SEHR WENIGE Wimmelbilder. Wirklich wenige.

FÃ¼r AnfÃ¤nger in diesem Genre durchaus geeignet und sehr schÃ¶n zum Ansehen und 2-3h Stunden abschalten. Erfahrene Wimmelbildspieler die gerne kniffelige RÃ¤tsel lÃ¶sen sollten die HÃ¤nde davon lassen.

review: The storyline is ridiculous, but all in all this game is entertaining and has nice music and environments. For the genre, it is one of the better ones because the puzzles are fun, not too easy or too difficult, and the achievements are very doable in one playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992760555', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1636888975}
review:
There's really not a lot of things related to Slavs in this game, apart from the word "Slavic" appearing everywhere you look.
The game is very easy and there's no challenge to it. The scenery is beautiful, but cut scenes and voice acting is meh.
Pretty disappointed.

review: Great little games.  I play a lot of more hardcore stuff, but these games are nice after a stressful day. review: I enjoyed the game. Not as much Slavic lore as I thought there would be but no big deal. You can get all achievements in one playthrough. As always, get HOGs when they're on sale as you can finish this game in about 3 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071153168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1628286564}
review: This hidden object game is very well done. You can play it quickly in about 7 hours or you can take your time to work out each puzzle unaided. The story is OK for most ages but puzzles will be to hard for small children. As someone of Slavic heritage I am curious to see what they have done over all the following games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197234309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1626613988}

author: {'steamid': '76561198216994776', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1626128288}
review: This was one of the more enjoyable HOG I've played. I liked the story and the Slavic folklore a lot. It has nice music, artwork, and puzzles (the kind of puzzles that I don't find myself skipping because I personally just can't wrap my brain around it). The voice acting was also decent which was nice!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1623796623}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Si l'histoire est plutÃ´t quelconque, l'ambiance est assez agrÃ©able, avec ses jolis visuels et sa musique douce-amÃ¨re emprunte de nostalgie. Le jeu suggÃ¨re de jouer avec le son, et c'est clairement un plus pour plonger dedans.

Le jeu est assez court et plutÃ´t facile, que ce soit les mini-jeux ou les scÃ¨nes d'objets cachÃ©s. J'ai dÃ©jÃ  vu mieux... elles sont assez variÃ©es, passant de trouver des objets identiques, Ã  trouver des objets dont on a la forme, Ã  trouver ceux dont on a la description.  Le "problÃ¨me", c'est que seuls ces derniers sont difficiles en gÃ©nÃ©ral, et lÃ  ils sont un peu trop faciles.

Les collectibles sont facilement trouvables, il ne m'en manquait qu'un seul en terminant le jeu - qui malheureusement n'est plus accessible si on prends un objet avant le collectible en question (heureusement, c'est assez proche du dÃ©but du jeu).

[h1]RejouabilitÃ©, achievements[/h1]

Comme d'habitude dans le genre, terminer le jeu en mode expert et trouver les collectibles. Pas de mode alternatif pour les SOC cette fois, ce qui permet de faire un seul run :).

[h1]En bref[/h1]

MalgrÃ© sa courte durÃ©e de vie, son ambiance un peu nostalgique est agrÃ©able. RecommandÃ©.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontrÃ©.

OS: Linux Mint 19 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Dualscreen, 1x 4K & 1x 1920x1200, un seul screen X.

I find Slavic mythology and heritage seriously under-represented and not just in the gaming world.
So thank you for this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087491748', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1613144729}
review:
It starts good but further you go the worse it gets.
Even though additional story is very short it sill is artificially extended (animation of flying owl).
Also it's recycled (happens partially on same locations as game)  and poorly designed.
+ collectables are possible to find in first run
+ cards with Slavic mythology
- after restart collectable cards are turned over
- at the end there are some budget cuts - eg. fireworks assemble themselves

author: {'steamid': '76561198129227544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1610393745}
review:
Nice point and click game, you actually can relax and you don't need to click every pixel to complete the puzzles.
Some "slavic mythology" is made up, but as a slav I don't mind. 
The game is as hard as it should be and entertained me for a couple of evenings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253561716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1610322317}
review: If you're familiar with the hidden object genre, you won't find any surprises here. It was exactly what I was looking for. The story is a bit cheesy, but I've yet to find a HOG that isn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274159405', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1610146782}
review:
Fun game with pretty art and solvable puzzles. The hidden object scenes are creative and serves a purpose to the story, instead of being there just to call it a hidden objects game. 
The translations are a bit off and the animations look weird and the game can become a bit tedious towards the end, but overall I liked it.
I would recommend you buy it when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041694487', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1605208944}
review:
Note before starting: I am playing on expert.
I have played quite a bit of hidden object/point and click games, and Artifex Mundi are the best when it comes to these types of games. Unfortunately I feel they missed the mark on this one. There were several times when the game asked you to go back to places that weren't interactable before, and some things are just awkward, as in you don't know what to do with some items, or it just feels silly. [spoiler]Like going back into the dungeon I could go into a corner that wasn't there before. Now this wouldn't be a bad thing, but there were NO INDICATION that I would be able to interact with this earlier, or go back there at all![/spoiler]

Some items are also a bit awkwardly named in the hidden objects minigames. [spoiler]Like hem instead of rudder?[/spoiler]

The game is a bit short, the story isn't amazing but as usual, the art is beautiful and soundtrack great!

review:
Eventide: Slavic Fable is a high quality puzzle/hidden object. Just what I've come to expect from Artifex Mundi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198893329311', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1704753727}
review:
AT A GLANCE:
     3/5 Stars - I had a few issues with this game in the beginning, but as the game went on they slowly melted away. One of them being the broad range the investigation prompt covered (described below). After finishing the game on casual and starting another game on expert, for achievement purposes, the broad range was no longer an issue for me. I recommend this game mainly because of how unique the mini-games are. 

GAME GENRE:
     Single Player, Hidden Object, Casual, Point n Click, Puzzle, Female Protagonist

GAME DESCRIPTION:
     Release Date: Jan. 2016 - Help Mary save her grandma, the Slavic creatures, and the endangered fern flower. Play through 38 locations, 43 hidden object scenes, and defeat the evil Boruta.

KID FRIENDLY:
     (First know that I am very strict on kid approved material. A game with a standard rating of "PG" I might rate "PG-13". These are my ratings and have nothing to do with standard ratings)

     I rate this "PG-13". There is a few inappropriate words, and the antagonist is the goat devil which might be inappropriate for some younger kids.

ACHIEVEMENTS:
     25 Achievements ranging from easy to easy moderate.

TRADING CARDS:
     5 Trading cards

PROS:
     -Achievements
     -Trading cards
     -Unique hidden object game
     -Interesting storyline

CONS:
     -Magnifying glass is too broad (see gameplay)

GAMEPLAY:
     The magnifying glass, which is used as a way to tell you to investigate something, has too broad of range. I couldn't tell if there was multiple objects to investigate or just one. As the game moves forward it becomes less of an issue.

VISUAL EFFECTS:
     Decent graphics, but no "wow factor" to them.

AUDIO:
     -Music - Soft, simple piano music
     -Sound Effects - Ok, fits what is going on
     -Voices - Majority of the voices were good, but one character talked so slow I couldn't wait for his cut scenes to end.

STORYLINE:
     Pretty decent storyline. I don't follow Slavic mythology so I can't speak for that, but the storyline was interesting to me.

REPLAY VALUE:
     I have played this game 3 times now all the way through. All of which has been within the last 24 hours to obtain all the achievements. My thoughts are; I can see myself playing this game again later down the road just for fun. So yes, good replay value.

PROBLEMS/ISSUES:
     None - No problems installing game. No issues during start up. No game freezes, or unexpected quitting.

WORDS FOR DEVELOPERS:
     Great game, thank you!

CURATOR:
     If you like my reviews please follow my Curator page. Thank you! :)
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37878480/

author: {'steamid': '76561199023747193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1595747692}
review: Beatufiul game with a few different minigames and a short but nice plot. Beat it in one sitting - could not bring myself to turn away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050051452', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1635658773}
review: A very well put together game. Highly recommend if you enjoy this type. I got most of the achievements during first play and then did a 2nd run right after on expert mode to try for the rest. Only missing 1 achievement called Bookworm and I'll break out a guide specifically for that one as I'm not sure what item I'm not reading during the game play; knowing myself it's probably something simplistically stupid right at the start. Majority of the puzzles are easy for people that enjoy puzzles. The hidden objects aren't overly difficult (you do have to "brush" some items out of the way to find what your after).

author: {'steamid': '76561199059691099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1594599424}
review: i loved this game and i would recommend to other people that love hidden object games.  I loved the puzzles and the hidden object puzzles in the game.  Nice story for the main and the side story as well.  Thumbs up from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064116127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1594320976}
review: I do not play much hidden objects games so I cannot compare to other games of the genre, but I was surprised that there very only a few hidden object screens and the majority of the game was about finding out the right object to combine with some place in the game. I like the minigames, most of them were fun, but the story (nothing extra) and some game mechanics which annoyed me (re-activation of hidden objects screens) are getting the game a no recommendation. It is not bad, I kind of miss the "neutral" button, but it is not worth recommending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034334205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1594189296}
review: Was in the mood for a Hidden Object, read a few top 10 articles where this game was featured as one of the best, so I decided to give it a try. It took all of 4 hours to play and was largely boring.  You stop caring about the plot shortly in and go from finding one piece of trash to the next with little change up and few puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076318061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1628696926}
review: great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198113243844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1589354244}
review:
"Eventide: Slavic Fable" stands out as my absolute favorite among all I've played. Discovering it here on Steam was a thrill, and I've played it four times before, relishing the experience once again on this platform. 

The game's beauty and atmospheric charm alone make it a standout. It never gets boring, always filled with a captivating blend of magic and mystery. The calm and pleasant music adds to the overall enjoyment, making it a delightful experience with each playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988515343', 'num_games_owned': 3195, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1592122182}
review: A fun little hidden object game with light to medium-ish difficulty puzzles.  However, as with all Artifex Mundi games, half the fun is in the story.  If you like HO games, you'll most likely like this one.  I haven't tried an Artfex Mundi game that I didn't enjoy so far, and I've tried a bunch of their games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049527760', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1674252371}
review: Not the best one from Artifex Mundi, but hands down the best music from all I have played so far. Also the bear made me really sad when I saw it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198336736463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1591590691}
review: Not my type of game at all, I wouldn't have installed it even if it was free. Although I can see a lot of love went into it. Unfortunately I paid for it, so it's getting a review. I'm more into AAA's, good graphics and this is NOT that. I bought this game key from G"2".A because of misleading advertising while thinking I was buying a Steam key for The Long Dark, can you imagine how annoyed I was. G^2".A refused refund, their name is mud now! I was tricked into buying this game so that can never end well for reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144593917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1590530852}
review: Games in the hidden object genre aren't usually the deepest entries, but what separates the good ones from the bad ones is mainly whether the story backdrop is something interesting with some mystery that is gradually revealed, making you want to play more, or whether the story is just a silly skin placed over the game. I would recommend Eventide because it falls into the first category. This game isn't exactly a masterpiece, but I enjoyed it because I was interested enough in the story to want to play more. I found it a relaxing, low-key experience that was pretty enjoyable. The puzzles are fine, but they are nothing special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067593196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1590914971}
review:
Eventide: Slavic Fable war ein richtig gutes und ein ganz anderes Spiel als Grim Legends 2 oder Queens Quest 1.

Pro:
+ die Musik war noch besser. Sehr epochale Musik mit Klavier-, GeigenklÃ¤ngen, BÃ¤ssen. Die verschiedenen StÃ¼cke haben mich alle sehr gepackt.
+ Die Grafik war mit Abstand die Beste bisher. KrÃ¤ftige schÃ¤rfere Farben, feinere Konturen und realistischere Effekte. Alle Spielabschnitte wirken noch runder bzw. harmonischer. Vor allem die Emotionen, die GefÃ¼hle der Figuren kommen sehr gut durch die Animationen zur Geltung. Die RÃ¤umlichkeiten waren alle sehr detailverliebt. Als Spieler konnte ich wahnsinnig viel auf einem Bildschirm entdecken, bzw. das Auge konnte ganz viel betrachten, bestaunen. Das war eine richtig schÃ¶ne Spielwelt, die zum TrÃ¤umen und Verweilen eingeladen hat, in der man sich verlieren konnte. Z. B. die Holzschnitzer Live Show. Das sind einfach Top Grafiken, die so wahnsinnig viele Geschichten auf einmal erzÃ¤hlen.
+ Die Story, bzw. Videos waren auf Ã¤hnlichen gutem hohem Niveau wie Grim Legends 2. Die Charaktere waren entsprechend auch sehr gut.
+ Es gab einige neue Zusatz-Adventure-Ideen und Elemente. Ãœberhaupt fand ich die Point & Click Passagen mit das Beste, was ich bisher gespielt habe. Dahingehend kann bisher nur The secret Order 2 und 3 mithalten. Die ganzen Objekte sind viel besser in die Bildschirme mit eingebunden worden, als ob sie echter Bestandteil der Spielwelt wÃ¤ren.
+ Die Extra SammelmÃ¶glichkeiten haben auch viel SpaÃŸ gemacht. 30 Monsterkarten und 30 Blumen waren im gesamten Spiel verstreut. Und viele davon auch in kleinen Spielbildschirmen, die man unter die Lupe genommen hat. Das war deutlich vielseitiger und weniger linear diesmal. Die Monsterkarten bestehen aus 30 unterschiedlichen Figuren, Mythen der slawischen MÃ¤rchenerzÃ¤hlungen. In Text und Bild wird die Figur nÃ¤her erlÃ¤utert. 

Kontra:
- Minispiele waren viel zu einfach. Ich hatte kaum eine Herausforderung. Die meisten der Minispiele kannte ich in der Art und Weise schon aus anderen Wimmelspielen. BloÃŸ, dass das jetzt abgespeckte vereinfachte Versionen davon waren, die man absolut blind hat lÃ¶sen kÃ¶nnen. DafÃ¼r waren sie hÃ¼bsch grafisch gestaltet und animiert. Einzig die ErzÃ¤hlspiele und die Point / Click Kobinationsspiele haben Ã¼berzeugt. Der Rest, na ja.
- Wimmelbilder waren zu wenige und auch zu einfach. Teilweise nur 9 Objekte suchen, statt der bisherigen 12 oder nur die gleichen Objekte unterschiedlich versteckt. Das hat im Vergleich zu anderen Wimmelspielen recht wenig Ã¼berzeugt.
- Der Storyverlauf hat kurzfristig etwas an Enigmatis 2 und Grim Legends 1 erinnert.
- Sehr schlichtes einfaches Tagebuch
- Keine Begleiter
- Einige Grammatikfehler in der Ãœbersetzung

Fazit: WÃ¼rde ich das Spiel aus reiner Adventure-Sicht bewerten, wÃ¤re es das beste Wimmelspiel, was ich bisher gespielt habe, siehe Pro's. Aber wenn ich das Ganze korrekterweise mit allen Elementen bewerte, stechen negativ die zu einfachen Minispiele und Wimmelspiele heraus. So war es aber trotzdem ein ganz besonderes schÃ¶nes Spiel, was mich sehr fasziniert hat. Insgesamt landet es in meiner persÃ¶nlichen Wertung ganz knapp hinter Grim Legends 2. Nach 9 Stunden Spielzeit war ich mit dem Hauptspiel plus Bonus-Kapitel fertig. Und ich habe mir wirklich viel Zeit gelassen, um die tolle Musik und Grafik zu genieÃŸen. WÃ¤ren die Wimmelspiele und Minispiele anspruchsvoller und mehr gewesen, wÃ¤re ich locker auf 11-12 Stunden Spielzeit gekommen.

PersÃ¶nliche Rangliste aller Wimmelspiele:
1. Queens Quest 1
2. Grim Legends 2
3. Eventide 1
4. Enigmatis 2
5. Grim Legends 1
6. The secret Order 3
7. The secret Order 2
8. Enigmatis 1

NÃ¤chstes Wimmelspiel: The secret Order 4

author: {'steamid': '76561198821234868', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2454, 'last_played': 1588674285}
review: Relativamente entretenido, bastante variedad de puzzles y escenas ricas en colores alegres. Historia correcta pero con algunos fallos visibles en el desarrollo, pero muy bien llevada y con un final que se agradece, desde luego que no serÃ¡ la mejor ni la mas original, pero me gusta. Las escenas son medianamente divertidas, aunque no les pondrÃ­a una puntuaciÃ³n muy alta en cuanto a originalidad. Se ve que no se han comido la cabeza mucho en ese aspecto y han preferido seguir sin arriesgar. Desaparece el castellano de este juego, dentro de lo malo lo agradezco, para que lo traduzcan mal y no saber que objeto busco, prefiero jugar en inglÃ©s, no me supone mucho problema no jugar en mi idioma nativo. Hablando desde una visiÃ³n general puedo decir que es un juego aceptable, con sus cosillas, pero recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034276568', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1586757523}
review:
All in all it's a cute game with a good story and pretty graphics, but there were a few smaller issues to note.  

-There were translation issues in both captions and in the list of objects in the hidden object scenes.  Items were sometimes misnamed or in one or two occasions not translated at all.  One example is in the bonus chapter, where it constantly refers to herbs as "plantago" in the game's text, only using the correct word in the voice lines.  For players who have the game muted or are hard of hearing, this makes things more difficult.  In the same section of the bonus chapter, moss is repeatedly referred to as mold, which can make finding the correct item confusing.  
-The map is vague and several rooms can be indicated as one location on the map, leading you to wander from one to the next looking for what you're supposed to do if you use the map to show you where you have tasks you can complete.  

Still, the game is playable and better than a number of other HOGs I have experienced.

author: {'steamid': '76561199036851888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1584984728}
review: This was my first hidden object game, as it's a new genre for me. Some people have noted that this game is very standard for a HOG, which bored them a bit. But that's exactly what I was looking for: a high-quality, but standard example of the genre. I had so much fun playing this and would highly recommend it for people interested in trying out HOGs. I did buy this game in a bundle, and for the length of the game I'm happy with the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186865498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1583581308}
review:
I think I might be overdoing it on the HOGs so this will be my last for a while, though it's certainly one of the better of the genre that I have played. The story is the usual fantasy nonsense but the graphics are just lovely, with enchanting, atmospheric environments and an easy-going difficulty level. The hidden object scenes themselves mostly add a new twist instead of just the usual list of things to find, and you'll make frequent and pleasing progression without hitting any dead-ends and you'll earn achievements/trophies every 20 minutes or so. A lot of HOGs suffer from translation issues which can be quite frustrating for English localizations, but Eventide has no such problems.

Of the 25 trophies I got all but one (the bookworm trophy) but once you finish the game it won't allow you to go back through all the locations to find you missed, meaning you have to play it ALL again just to get a perfect game. Kinda uncool. Trading cards are also included. There's only 5 to collect so I got all the way to badge level 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1583621396}
review:
Spielwertung: 9/10

Sehr solide "slawische ErzÃ¤hlung" mit der ein oder anderen Ãœberraschung.

- alles wie immer, wer AM kennt, wird sich sofort zurechtfinden.
- positiv: drei Schwierigkeitsgrade, aktive Map, Quicktravelfunktion
- schÃ¶ne ErzÃ¤hlung, ob das jetzt alles erfunden ist oder tatsÃ¤chlich auf historischen Quellen oder Fabeln beruht, im Vergleich zu den absurden MÃ¤rchengeschichten zum Teil ein netter "Kontext"
- relativ kurze Spielzeit: Hauptspiel rund 3 Stunden, Bonus gefÃ¼hlt 20 Minuten, letzterer auch sehr, sehr leicht
- interessant: Klassische Wimmelbildszenen gibt es hier fast gar nicht, generell wenig Suchszenen. Geschmackssache, ob man das mag, zur Abwechslung fand ich es voll in Ordnung
- schon lÃ¤nger nicht mehr gespielt: 2 zusÃ¤tzliche ingame-Suchobjekte auf der gesamten Map: Blumen und Karten. Die Blumen sind sehr leicht zu finden, bei den Karten habe ich am Ende nur 28/30 gefunden, wer also unbedingt 100% will, sollte hier aufpassen. Das Gute ist, dass das Spiel zwischen Finale und Abspann kurz Luft lÃ¤sst, um noch zu vervollstÃ¤ndigen. Die Karten sind wie Sammelkarten von Pokemon, nur eben mit "slawischen Fabelwesen", teilweise recht abstruse Behauptungen, aber fÃ¼r Neugierige durchaus einen Blick wert. 

Fazit: SchÃ¶nes Spiel von AM, die slawischen Themen liegen der Firma ja von Natur aus "nÃ¤her". Man sollte nicht zu viel erwarten, so wie immer bei den "Mini-MÃ¤rchen" im AM-Universum, aber man hat zuverlÃ¤ssig fÃ¼r eine kurze Weile SpaÃŸ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052332539', 'num_games_owned': 976, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1583335755}
review:
[h1]*Eventide: Slavic Fable* - Mystisches Abenteuer im Freilichtmuseum[/h1]

Eventide: Slavic Fable lÃ¤sst uns in eine Sagenwelt mit allerlei Fabelwesen eintauchen. Diese mystische Welt gilt es in unserem Abenteuer mit Hilfe einer magischen Farnblume zu retten. DafÃ¼r mÃ¼ssen wir wie immer den BÃ¶sewicht im Spiel aufhalten, damit er diese wundersame Welt nicht zerstÃ¶ren kann.

Die RÃ¤tsel im Spiel sind sehr einfach gehalten, so dass man sich auch auf "Experte" gemÃ¼tlich durch die Geschichte klicken kann. Die Wimmelbilder sind dabei sehr abwechslungsreich. Neben der klassischen Suche anhand einer Liste gibt es auch solche Wimmelbilder, bei denen man gefundene Sachen benÃ¶tigt, um diese auf der Suche nach weiteren Dingen wieder einzusetzen, oder solche, bei denen man eine Reihe vorgegebener Teile finden muss, um den fÃ¼r das weitere Spiel benÃ¶tigten Gegenstand zusammenzubauen. Diese Abwechslung hat mir sehr gut gefallen.

Einziger kleiner Kritikpunkt: die "Logik" hinter den RÃ¤tseln bzw. bei der Suche nach benÃ¶tigten GegenstÃ¤nden lÃ¤sst in der zweiten HÃ¤lfte des Spieles ein wenig nach.

Ansonsten wartet das Spiel mit einem Sammelmodus (Karten, Blumen und Notizen), einem kurzen Bonuskapitel und leicht erzielbaren Achievements (in einem Spieldurchgang) auf. 

Insgesamt ein sehr gelungenes Wimmelbildspiel, das mir wirklich sehr gut gefallen hat. Klare Empfehlung!

review: There's some nice art and music in this game. The puzzles themselves are alright, but a few of the late game solutions are just stupid. It's short too, I took my time and completed all the content in this game in about 6 hours. I'd only recommend buying it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026806776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1582380475}
review: [i]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/i] was a touch disappointing for a game from Artifex Mundi, from whom I normally expect superior hidden-object games.  Some small graphical issues and occasionally ham-handed localisation are present.  Even so, it's still a competently done HOG, with nice animation.  Good, overall, but not exceptional.

review: Really nice, chilled out game. It's not particularly hard, so if you're looking for an easy click and touch game, I recommend this one. I enjoyed this game thoroughly during some down-time after work.

review: These games are the best chill for an afternoon games ever made.  Well done.  Story rich.  Puzzles that are fun and interesting without being too hard, but can be challenging (i've had to use hint a couple times).  Love em.  Love these games.  Put down the raging for a few hours and enjoy a silly story with bad acting but great puzzles.  Good for a hangover game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1580713153}
review:
Very enjoyable puzzle adventure.
Puzzles should be suitable for young players and those who have difficulty concentrating.

Pros:
- Selection of difficulty levels, ability to turn voice-overs on or off.
- In-game map allows fast travel.
- Art, graphics, and narration were all fine - exactly what you'd expect for in these sorts of games.
- Little/No language errors, although one or two items in hidden object scenes were labelled by a less common term for the item. 

Cons:
- Predictable plot (but this didn't detract from the fun of the game at all).

Other:
- One of the collectables doesn't have a tracker for it, but if you want that achievement all you have to do is click on everything that is clickable.
- The bonus episode is extremely fast and easy. However, as the main game took me a few hours, I don't have a problem with the bonus episode taking less than one hour. A short bonus chapter is much better than one that's almost as long as the main game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1526124579}
review:
[i]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/i] is an enchanting little hidden object game made by The House of Fables working under the well known developer/publisher team, Artifex Mundi who specialize in this genre. These kinds of games are simpler point and click adventures with scenes where we have to find certain listed items by clicking on them in order to progress, while also having adventure (item collection + combination) features. This particular one is centered around a unique fantasy/tale inspired park with strange creatures.

We play as Mary, a botanist who receives an urgent message from her grandmother asking for her help to save a rare mysterious plant in a heritage park (presumably in the US). Upon arrival we are immediately attacked by a huge batlike creature and it also kidnaps our grandma. The park is apparently full of mythical creatures and we'll need their help in order to save our grandma, the flower (that only blossoms at midsummer night) and to stop the evil magician who plans to abuse the powers of the park.

These kinds of simplistic storylines can be filled up with plenty of content and this is what [i]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/i] basically does. The exclamation on the steam store page - "Explore the exciting world of slavic legends!" - may sound a bit pretentious because as far as I know slavic nations are very diverse in culture and I'm not sure if this mythological world depicted here could be connected to them as a whole. For me the little creatures were distant and didn't find them as cute and likeable as the developers intended them to be. 

Still the game has one major redeeming attribute in this aspect and that is the beautiful magical forested area it takes place in for the most part (we also visit a medieval castle). This alone could carry the game on its own even if the other components were forgettable. But that is fortunately not the case, there's a fair amount of enjoyable (easy) puzzles to solve. Strangely enough there are actually less hidden object and fragmented object scenes than these minigames, but I didn't mind this, since personally I prefer creative minigames over HOs. 
The other thing to mention is the amount of items: there are so many of them to carry around that I sometimes had trouble finding use for them. At some locations I'm pretty sure I didn't use them or they just remained in my inventory, but I was still able to progress anyway. This is rather strange since generally in adventure and hidden object games items usually disappear after they have fulfilled their duty, that may occur after multiple uses sometimes.
As for collectibles we can search for bestiary cards (we can look up these creatures from our book/diary).
There's also a bonus chapter (which is always nice) which takes us back into our childhood where we can learn more about this special fern we managed to acquire in the main game. This time we have to heal our Mom using the magical healing properties of the flower.

The visuals are something I liked very much and while more recent HOGs have better graphics, the locations are simply amazing to look at. I love forests and since almost the entire game takes place in an eerie looking enchanting forest I absolutely loved it. I also liked how there was always something in motion in the backgrounds like falling leaves or hovering dragonflies. The menu with the interactive buildings on the main screen was also a nice touch.
The animations however were rather cheap and poorly done compared to what we usually encounter in Artifex Mundi originals like the ones seen in the [url=store.steampowered.com/bundle/2583/Nightmares_from_the_Deep_Collection/]Nightmares from the Deep series[/url].

Sounds and especially the very relaxing music are also strong parts of the game, it never gets irritating with some nice melodies here and there. It's as enchanting as the forest itself and fits the location and the mood of the game nicely. Some of the creatures are voiced by the same person, but I don't usually criticize a game for such things (I could even appreciate it when someone successfully provides their voice to many characters).

[i]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/i] is a charming example of its genre and while its plot is definitely not its highlight, the amazing environment and general atmosphere that surrounds it is great. The numerous minigames are also something to be praised even if they aren't particularly special to this genre. All in all it's a well above average hidden object game and if you like forests and HOGs, look no further.

PROS
+ fantastic locations and atmosphere, beautiful scenery
+ more minigames, less HOG scenes
+ nice bonus chapter
+ fitting, relaxing music

CONS
- simple plot contrary to what the slavic theme could offer
- character animations are poor
- the creatures feel awkward

RATING
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017736253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1694738080}
review:
I really wanted to like this game. It's not horrible, or bad. But bottom line, aside from the graphics, it didn't do anything else very good

Pros:
* Nice graphics. Better than your average hidden-object game. With actual cut-scenes and even some animation
* The hidden objects mechanics that pops-up every now and then is rather nice, and forces you to be observant

Cons:
* Puzzles are a tad too easy. When they're not, there's probably some pixel hunting involved
* Story is *meh*. Storyline is basic to non-existent
* No "slavic fable" anything involved, so if you were expecting that, this is not the game you were looking for

It's not a great game, but if you want to pass a couple of hours this might be for you (and even then, please try to buy it on sale, because because you'd be angry for the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032596719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1567887636}
review: Very odd story.  I'm not Slavic and have no ties to the culture at all so I have no way of saying "YEAH, totally true to tradition!"  In fact, it's weird that they haven't been tagged for singling out a culture in a game title in these paralytically PC times.  Still, an enjoyable if not particularly memorable way to pass time if you find it on sale and not many games left to play in your library on a lazy weekend day.  Definitely one to put on the wish list until it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029608584', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1568843269}
review:
A nice quick casual game. Special interest, if you ask me. The story is okay: Not too exciting, but not too boring either.
Achievement-wise the BOOKWORM one is a bit annoying, since it's easy to miss one freakin' note (I missed the last one on the final screen because I finished the game prematurely).

Unfortunately again a 2nd playthrough is required in Expert mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091958907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1567711752}
review:
Definitely recommend!

Pros:
.Engaging story
.Well done atmosphere
.Lovely clean, crisp artwork/graphics/scenes
.Enhancing music/sounds/voice acting
.Three difficulty modes (no custom)
.Mini-map with fast travel (receive in-game)
.Lockable toolbar
.Object glows when in place for possible use
.Intricate, challenging adventure play 
.Variety of hidden object scenes
.Variety of mini-puzzles
,Collectables (flowers and cards)
.Bonus chapter

Cons
.Mini-map indicated areas, not individual scenes
.Reused hidden object scenes
.Easy mini-puzzles
,Short

Final words (8/10):
This was the first game I played in this genre and it reeled me right in.  I replayed the game to do this review and still found it to be a delightful experience, well worth the time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102924698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1566354745}
review: Good game, really liked it. Very interesting story, game play flowed well. Only issue was that in Casual mode, puzzles were too easy or too hard, there was nothing in the middle. Would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101776626', 'num_games_owned': 5243, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1565914799}
review:
A bit disappointed by this one, the problem wasn't the story it was how far stretched the Hidden Object scenes were. I played in Expert and there were some point I had to use the hint to know where I was suppose to go next.
For example, when you go to the dungeon, if you click on the torture tools on the left, she makes a comment, then at some point it suddenly becomes a Hidden Object scene. The same happens with some stairs you cannot access to all along the game, except at the very end.
Expect as well to keep the items at 2/3 or simply having them in your inventory for really really long before finding their use.
There were also weird descriptions of what you need. When the character says that she needs something "heavy" to break an already half wrecked lid, my thought is to use the helmet I just got, not the pickaxe that I'll get at least 30mn and a lot of scenes after.
Speaking of the Pickaxe, it feels like it's the most powerful item of the game.. Or they just gave up after so long, so you use the pickaxe to recover a piece of relief that I would consider as fragile, unstuck something under a wheel and finally break the damn lid.
I really hope that the next one will be better on that side, I never felt so lost or had this many troubles to understand which tool I was supposed to use.
