review:
Ce premier opus de la sÃ©rie [i]Eventide[/i] est une rÃ©elle dÃ©ception Ã  laquelle les jeux estampillÃ©s [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] nous ont peu habituÃ©s.


[h1]ScÃ©nario[/h1]
Mary, l'hÃ©roÃ¯ne, est invitÃ©e par sa grand-mÃ¨re qui gÃ¨re un parc pour l'aider Ã  sauver une plante rare qui dÃ©pÃ©rit. Evidemment, rien ne va se passer comme prÃ©vu. A peine arrivÃ©e Ã  destination, Mary va Ãªtre victime d'un accident de voiture, combattre l'incendie qui ravage la maison de son aÃ¯eule et Ãªtre tÃ©moin impuissante de l'enlÃ¨vement de celle-ci.

Un trÃ¨s court chapitre bonus propose une autre histoire dans les mÃªmes lieux.


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
HOG classique dans lequel on doit trouver des objets Ã  utiliser ensuite au bon endroit, rÃ©soudre quelques puzzles et SOC et Ã©ventuellement collecter des objets facultatifs.
Il possÃ¨de naturellement tous les Ã©lÃ©ments habituels : inventaire, journal, carte, 3 niveaux de difficultÃ©, systÃ¨me d'aide.


[h1]Points positifs[/h1]
La rÃ©alisation est soignÃ©e tant techniquement qu'artistiquement.

Beaucoup d'objets Ã  trouver et utiliser.

Des SOC qui misent moins sur la quantitÃ© que sur la diversitÃ©.


[h1]Points nÃ©gatifs[/h1]
Le scÃ©nario est dÃ©cevant car non seulement il n'Ã©voque les [i]fables slaves[/i] que de maniÃ¨re trÃ¨s anecdotique...

... mais il passe aussi bien vite au second plan pour ne demeurer qu'un vague prÃ©texte pour justifier la progression en nos rappelant qu'on doit aller dÃ©livrer la grand-mÃ¨re.

Le jeu manque terriblement d'originalitÃ© et propose des situations, des Ã©nigmes et des mini-jeux dÃ©jÃ  vus et revus, y compris la plupart des clichÃ©s malheureusement trop frÃ©quent dans les jeux du genre.

La difficultÃ© est totalement absente, y compris en difficultÃ© max.

La durÃ©e de vie est ridiculement courte, mÃªme pour un HOG : moins de 3h pour l'aventure principale et pas plus de 30min pour le chapitre bonus (en difficultÃ© max).


[h1]En bref[/h1]
Les fanatiques absolus du genre y trouveront peut-Ãªtre leur compte s'ils acquiÃ¨rent le titre en soldes. 
Quant aux autres joueurs, ils dÃ©ploreront l'absence de difficultÃ©, la manque de contenu et les limites du scÃ©nario et estimeront  que ce jeu est loin d'Ãªtre indispensable dans leur bibliothÃ¨que.

Pour moi, le jeu cumule trop de lacunes. Une aventure peut Ãªtre courte si elle est intense, un scÃ©nario un peu lÃ©ger compensÃ© par des dÃ©fis difficiles ou des Ã©nigmes manquants de challenge acceptÃ©es grÃ¢ce Ã  une histoire prenante ou un contenu important.


[i]Eventide : Slavic Fable[/i] n'Ã©chappe donc pas au pouce rouge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978350645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1554261834}
review: Very nice traditional hidden object game, on par with the usual level of quality we have come to expect from Artifex Mundi. There is nothing new here that you haven't already seen in a dozen other HOGs, but really all one can reasonably expect from this type of game is that the artwork in attractive, and that the gameplay unfolds in a somewhat logical way so that you are not constantly having to spam the hint button to figure out what to do next, and Eventide succeeds on both counts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038570229', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1550979788}
review:
edit: I forgot to mention that I literally fell asleep playing this game, and because I slept past where I could return it, I just had to finish it. 

So I really enjoy hidden object games. I find them super soothing, and fun, and usually there's some pretty nice art. This game... is definitely on the lower end of hidden object games. Firstly, there's very few, if ANY, references to Slavic lore, past your grandmother being hamfistedly nicknamed 'Baba'. Second, there's very few actual hidden object puzzles in the game, and the ones that are there are extremely easy. There's very few puzzles, and no puzzles that took me more than 2 minutes to do. Most of the 'puzzles' in the game were needless backtracking to try to figure out what in the world the game wanted me to do. The story is extremely weak as well--I won't spoil anything in case you are, for whatever reason, extremely invested, but the 'villain's' backstory is... so stupid. It's so dumb. The voice acting is way more jilted than any other Artifex Mundi game I've played, and there's typos galore, a couple of which actually got read aloud! Go play Grim Legends or the Davy Jones series. The puzzles are pretty much just copies of eachother, but at least they're competent copies with slightly interesting plots. 

The stupidest puzzle I encountered was one where I had to tie a magnet to a stick and string (but not a piece of rope I had earlier) in order to fish a puzzle piece... out of an open cage that I could clearly reach into. To be fair, there was a skeleton in the cage, so maybe she just didn't want to touch it?

Oh also there's a power outlet in the STONE WALL of the MEDIEVAL CASTLE. How in the world did they install that. Extra extra points for it involving a puzzle where you plug in a fan near a wet surface. 'Cause [i]that's[/i] not an electrical hazard at all.

review: I love adventure point and click games.  So simple, yet so relaxing and fun.  The graphics take you to another world altogether, similarly with the music.  The plot is simple, but clever and when I want to escape into a world of my own, cut off from the everyday hassle of work, these games are the best solution.  Secondly, I support Artifex Mundi because they're Polish, so I like them and want them to succeed on an international scale :D

review: The Eventide series focuses on Slavic Mythology mixed with a modern setting and the first game in the series is fairly promising. Overall, it's another typical Hidden Object game but it did seem there fewer hidden object scenes here than in other similar games I've played. It's also rather unimpressive visually for a game that's still relatively recent. As always though, it's still an enjoyable time and absolutely worth a try if you can get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269060330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1548505525}
review:
I had been eyeing off the Eventide series for quite some time and I am so glad I finally bought the bundle at the last sale, because it started off so well! Eventide: Slavic Fable was beautifully drawn, great music, interesting (variety and easy) puzzles, and the story was pretty good too. I also enjoyed that most of the mechanics seemed to make logical sense most of the time, so only in a couple of instances did I end up wondering around aimlessly trying to find the thing to set off the next thing.

The achievements were fairly easy to get as most of them are earned as you progress through the story. That being said, I did have to go through it again for the cards and the bookworm achievements, as I missed the very (very) last ones after getting caught up in the excitement of the story.

I definitely recommend this for lovers of point-and-click adventures and those into fairytales or mythical beasts. I am looking forward to playing through the next two in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198354715942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1547785746}
review: I like that the game was a combinaton of puzzle solving and hidden object activites. It seemed to short, and I wish there was more that would describe the mythological creatures that you come in contact with throughout the game. I also wish there was more of a balance between hidden object and problem solving. If it is categorized as a hidden object game, it should probably have more of it. All in all, I loved it and I will definitely be playing it again.

review:
Il primo capitolo di una serie di tre giochi, che si basano sulla favole mitologiche slave. Anche in questo caso, Artifex Mundi presenta un prodotto ben fatto, con grafica piacevole, rilassante pur nel susseguirsi di eventi talvolta drammatici. Il gioco non presenta niente di diverso o particolare rispetto ad altri dello genere. Un " Oggetti Nascosti " che si lascia giocare. 
Lo consiglio solo in sconto, il prezzo pieno Ã¨ esagerato.
Voto: 7/10

Lo que veo es que es extremadamente fÃ¡cil, y no es que yo sea una especialista en estos juegos, pero creo que debe tener una dificultad superior. Por lo demÃ¡s genial, muy entretenido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027480683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1638590019}
review:
Not a bad game, just not a very good one.
Even on Expert the biggest obstacle is poor design, not good puzzle-solving.
The last level in particular has a problem with sending you backwards to previous locations to collect tools that were not previously available, and it doesn't have any indication that they have become so. You just need to brute-force search until you find that particular tool.

And though it's not very important to the gameplay, the character modeling is truly bizarre.

There are better puzzle games to play.

ETA: Also, there are no saves or checkpoints, yet there is missable content. So if you pass something by accident or click a hint or skip without meaning to, you will need to play through the ENTIRE game again.

review: Ein sehr schÃ¶nes Spiel. Die RÃ¤tsel sind nicht zu leicht, aber auch nicht zu schwer. Die Story ist stimmig und lÃ¤d zum weiter spielen ein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008512424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1545959032}
review:
This game is so very charming. The art and music work really well together to make for a beautiful and relaxing experience, while the puzzling isn't difficult enough to be a constant hindrance even though some parts seem to lack some sort of guiding. (In some parts of the game you have to revisit a hidden object screen or two, to create objects that you now suddenly need even though there is nothing pointing this out to you.) Central to the puzzles is relying on knowledge of the objects that are depicted, e.g. that you'd want to apply tar to seal the repairs you made to a wooden rowboat, so different people will inevitably find the game easier than others might.

While I cannot judge whether the mythological parts are accurate to real world folk myths, the writing is honestly a delight. It's cheesy/hammy enough in the right places to be entertaining and engaging while also making me go along with both the voice acting that sometimes gets a bit rough, as well as all the silly point and click stuff the main character has to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013130865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1542425916}
review:
Eventide: Slavic Fable has an amazing trove of imaginative artwork for its fabled creatures. This is the best feature of the game. There were several aggressively cute pieces of artwork (the bonus baby bear and Lilacus and his duck shirt take the prize imo) mixed with a whole lot of unique and well done ugly (ex. the Patton Oswalt thing at the Woodcarving show). There is a broad blend of tried and true puzzle options that those who play hidden object games frequently will find familiar, but will be a wonderful introduction to the genre for new players.

The story was ... different, and yet it too was familiar. The hero has a doctorate of some sort (in magical plant studies one must guess) but the setting is a theme park, which seems to be a real go-to general locale for these type of games. Just change the theme of the park, and poof, a whole new hidden object game. There were several typos throughout, and a few very strangely named objects (Morgenstern?) but this was manageable.

I recommend this game based upon the high cute factor combined with an overall solid casual game experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 1843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1536973033}
review:
Good adventure HOG.  Puzzles are reasonable for the casual gamer without being either pointlessly easy or frustratingly difficult.

The premise is interesting, the art is nice, and the music suits the game.

Overall, a solid game.  The bonus story was a little short, and the game itself wasn't quite as long or involved as it could have been, but otherwise there are no particular flaws.  There isn't a lot new here, but the setting was good and I enjoyed playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034193738', 'num_games_owned': 2536, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1536042293}
review:
[b]Eventide 1: Slavic Fable [/b](FROG/IHOG)

Options include separate sliders for Music and Sound, Custom Cursor, HD, and you can turn off Voice Overs if you wish.  There are three difficulties to choose from: Casual, Advanced and Expert.

The Graphics are very pretty, and the voice-overs are mostly good.  There was one character that talked so slowly that it drove me batty every time we had to interact with him.

There are two types of [b]Collectibles[/b] to watch for: 30 Flowers and 30 Character Cards. The cards are especially interesting, as they teach you about Slavic mythological creatures.  Cool!

The Hidden Object portion of the game seems to lean more towards Fragmented Objects, rather than find-by-list, and both types are lightly-interactive.

Story-wise, there's some pretty serious stuff going on, yet the overall feeling of the game is still relaxing and calm.

Despite Slavic Fable being released as a Standard Edition only, it includes [b]CE content[/b], including:
[list]
[*]Bonus Chapter
[*]20 re-watchable Cutscenes
[*]5 downloadable Music tracks
[*]6 Wallpapers (in three different resolutions)
[*]12 replayable HOS
[*]12 Concept Art
[*]25 Achievements
[/list]
The Bonus Chapter is pretty short, but gives us a little bit of backstory and a few new locations.

Eventide: Slavic Fable is nothing groundbreaking, as far as the genre goes, but it did make for a pleasant afternoon.  Recommended for IHOG and FROG fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004578209', 'num_games_owned': 2928, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1534093480}
review: First I need to say that recorded does not reflect actual time in game.  I play a lot of times not online and I don't know if steam records that time so if it does then something is wrong with my PC or steam.  I enjoyed this game very much.  It is a somewhat more simple HOG but the story and sweet disposition makes up for that.  I only left two achievements unfinished: I did not get all collectible cards (I was a little too quick in some areas but you can go back and search as long as you do not finish the game.  There is a running tally so you have no excuse except for not paying attention-this is a HOG so of course you are paying attention?) The last achievement was playing on expert mode.  While I like this game very much I am not going back and replay on expert mode because I have too many games in my inventory that I need to play them first.  I don't always stick to this but I am with this game.  On the settings page there is a section where you can look at videos get wallpapers and look at artwork, etc.  Here you can look at all the HOG scenes.  Don't know if you can open any before the game is complete and I did not wan't to try and spoil all the fun of playing them in the game.  I did go back and replay the HOGs where only one scene was there any variety so they will get old kinda fast. The story?  You're a young lady who has to save grandma, and thats all I'm saying about that.  There is a bonus game where you have to save mama and thats all I'm saying about that.  Cuteness factor is high so if that does not appeal to you then don't play.  But play, I believe you will enjoy your time with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142388245', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1533466442}
review:
Best point-and-click from Artifex Mundi I've played.

- Puzzles are interactive and require several steps to continue
- Doesn't feel like forced puzzles / stall for time
- Puzzle pieces are spread over various points in the story (not find all in a particular area)

author: {'steamid': '76561198218925323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1688050186}
review:
Eventide: Slavic Fable ist ein sehr gutes Wimmelbildspiel. Im Spiel wird eine schÃ¶ne und logische Geschichte erzÃ¤hlt. Der Zeichenstil ist sehr hÃ¼bsch und die einzelnen Szenen ansprechend arrangiert. Die RÃ¤tsel und Wimmelbilder fÃ¼gen sich harmonisch ins Spielgeschehen ein und bestechen durch ihre Liebe zum Detail.
Die RÃ¤tsel und Wimmelbilder sind auf der Schwierigkeitsstufe Normal gut zu bewÃ¤ltigen (habe es auf Normal in ca. 5 Stunden durchgespielt)
Aus meiner Sicht absolut empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027686399', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1687767799}
review:
I have to admit, I'm a bit disappointed. I've heard of the Eventide series as being very popular, and while I enjoyed this one and am glad I played it, it wasn't as fun as I was hoping. It was pretty standard as far as Artifex Mundi HOGs go.

Still, disappointed or not, I bought it on sale and I don't regret it. It was an enjoyable few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035519735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1515385471}
review:
Firstly, I'd lke to state this isn't a [i]bad[/i] game. However I really can't recommend it. Unless perhaps you haven't played many Hidden Object - Point and Click (HOPAC) games before. I've played a lot of HOPAC games by Artifex Mundi and this is the first one that had very positive reviews that I really didn't like. I wish there had been more negative reviews that had pointed out some of the flaws because there are better HOPAC games out there for the same price or less.

 In one word this game is; [b]Disappointing[/b].

Even if this is your first HOPAC I would recommend you buy [b]Grim Tales Forsaken Bride[/b] instead. Much of the game play - especially the mini games - are identical to those in Forsaken Bride, but Forsaken Bride does everything so much better.

As mentioned in some of the other negative reviews there is very little that is 'slavic' about this game apart from the overuse of the label 'slavic'. The story is increadibly sparse compared to other Artifex Mundi games and has very little to do with the puzzles you have to solve to progress. The result was you end up feeling like youre pressing a next button for no reason and it becomes boring very quickly.

If finding pitchforks in stainglass window sills and going back and forth a lot between scenes to solve puzzles sounds like fun then you will probably enjoy this game.
If you are looking for a narrative driven puzzle game where there is some logic to where you find items and what you then use them on this game may not be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119412142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1528199740}
review:
crappy. I enjoy hidden objects but this one just irritates me.

con - the window around an area of interest is so big you often click it again mistaking it for something else to look at
 - the acting is over to top. The kid is too cutesy and the villian too outrageous.
- the story is average but not really engaging.

pro - ummm cannot think of one. I guess it does it job but would put this in the average category.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982940540', 'num_games_owned': 1150, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1526158616}
review: My first game of this type (hidden object). I like graphics (and animation with it) but story is pretty poor. Main story campaing took me aprox 3 hours (on middle difficulty) and bonus campaing took aprox one hour. I guess thats acceptible for this type of game. If the game was longer I would probably got bored before I could finish it. I got it for few cents from bundle so I will rate positively. But I wouldnt personally pay more than 2$ for it. Although Im not a fan of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004233477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1525318459}
review:
The Eventide series of hidden object puzzle adventures is one of the crown jewels in the Artifex Mundi family. I think part of its strength is the fact the game focuses on a heroine in a unique setting with a unique profession. In the case of the Eventide series, the games follow a botanist who explores various fantastical environs in the modern day.

Eventide 1 introduces us to our heroine. She's visiting her grandmother's "heritage park", like a historical reenactment village, and learns that various Slavic myths are real. She uses her botany skills and the help of some fantasy creatures to solve the issue at hand.

The art in this game, as in the sequels, is gorgeous, as is the music. 

What I really appreciate is that, although the game is somewhat easy, the game is very well crafted. Most puzzles and thematic elements directly have to do with botany or fantasy stuff. There isn't a ton of filler. It's highly immersive, and that, above all else, is what I care about in a hidden object puzzle game.

Details for HOPA fans:

- There are collectibles in the game, a few different kinds

- If you liked Nightmares from the Deep or the Enigmatis series, you'll really like this game/series

- Although the game may, on the surface, seem similar to Enigmatis: Ravenwood, the games are very different. The only things they have in common are that they're high quality games that have a similar color palette and feature heroines who use their professional skills to solve a problem in an amusement park type of setting (at least for Eventide 1 and Enigmatis 2 specifically, not other games in those series). The differences are tone, professions of the heroines and how those relate to the game (and both play major roles in the game), and genre (I'd say Ravenwood leans way more into horror and Eventide leans way more into mythological fantasy).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008914127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1527527233}
review:
This game isn't awful, it just isn't so good that I'd recommend it.  Artiflex Mundi are definitely one of my favourite developers when it comes to games, but this one feels a bit lazy as if they just wanted more of the same.

The story is pretty standard - you need to save a park and your grandmother. You meet characters along the way, solve puzzles and some hidden object scenes. They are generally logical and take a little bit of thought but aren't too taxing. 

The opportunity for it to be based on slavic mythology could have been really interesting bu they don't make much of this at all. Some of the rendering of some of the characters is also sloppy, bordering on nightmarish - bucktoothed-squirrel-boy with his hands firmly on his pants anyone?

The game also feels very short indeed. If I were you I'd stick to Enigmatis by the same publisher. Much better (certainly 1 and 2 - haven't played 3 yet) and more rewarding games all round.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259764178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1516798923}
review:
That was definitely beyond what I was expecting. The story and slavic mythical creatures setting was interesting and there was a good mixture of difficulty and variety with the puzzles. It wasn't all just point and click, and it wasn't all super easy nor was it too hard, right in the goldilocks range in my opinion.

The bonus stage really brought the story and characters around for me. They were nice, but by the bonus stage, I liked them more.

If you're a fan of puzzle and hidden object games, and enjoy a dash of mythology, this game will be right up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996624005', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1516488978}
review:
This game combines a narrative about slavic mythological creatures with hidden objects and logic puzzles. You are a  heroine in a slavic fairytale theme park who must travel through different settings, combine objects to create tools and interact with characters. One of my favorite parts of this game is the beautiful artwork.  The storyline and cut scenes for this game are fun and moderately compelling.I also find this style game very relaxing since there is no time limit to accomplish tasks/games.I also reccomend this game for ages 10 and up since the modes allow you to vary the difficulty. Depending on the mode you choose, you can look for where on the map you need to take action, you can press the hint button (reloads at different speeds) and you can skip any of the puzzle games. I believe most people would finish this game in 10-12 hours. One thing to keep in mind for this style game is that the objects you must find can be in really odd arbitrary places and a lot of objects you find are broken, so you have to fix them before use. You will have to go back and forth between settings in order to open trunks/objects and create tools. This particular game isn't as outrageous in the location of objects but it is something you have to accept in order to enjoy these hidden object games. There are dozens of these style games, so if you like it there are a wide variety of stories with the same game mechanics.

TLDR
Slavic Mythological creature narrative with hidden picture and logic puzzles.

PROS
-Beautiful Artwork
-Varying difficulties (modes) 
-Simple game mechanics
-No time limits for puzzles
-All players can beat/ complete the story
-Enjoyable for a variety of ages
-Narrative moderately compelling/creative
-Bonus game with collectors edition fun

CONS
-Short game (10-12 hours of play)
-Low replay value
-Must sustain disbelief when finding objects in odd locations

author: {'steamid': '76561197983794856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1515100736}
review:
After buying, and playing a few minutes of the game Hope Lake, I started getting absurd amounts of these similar object-hunting puzzle games from Artifex Mundi recommended to me on Steam. Because of the Steam Christmas Sale, I figured I'd give of them a try to see if they were my cup of tea. I went with this one because I was curious how it'd go into Slavic myths. Unfortunately, it does so very superficially, just using a few names of monsters and spirits.

I will say the game is quite pretty, with lovely painted and photoshopped graphics mostly in a motion comic style. The music isn't bad either.

Gameplay isn't great though, and I suspect all these games are largely the same. It's like playing an adventure game where every item you try to pick up first has to be repaired or reassembled, and almost nothing you find is relevant to the direct area, which pads out the game as you constantly have to go back and forth through locations. The game has a hint system that directs you to the next possible action (slowly recharging depending on which difficulty setting you chose), but I mostly found myself using it to direct me to whichever one of the fifteen simultaneously unsolved puzzle locations I needed to use the little wooden reindeer or seashell or owl medallions for, because I sure couldn't remember anymore.

Periodicially, you face screens that are completely cluttered with random items, and you'll have to click on a bunch of items either by a list of words or a series of pictures at the bottom of the screen. The game protects itself from you just madly clicking all over the place by punishing such behavior with a misty haze falling over the screen and the character remarking that they must calm down. What I found annoying at least in this game, is that many times the items you must find are a bunch of indistinct bits of piping, horn or wood that make them really hard to distinguish from the background, especially since they're often mostly obscured by other junk. I get that's sort of the point, but at least make them recognizable items so I can actually look for them.

That said, the game is very, very easy, so much that I think it's meant more for young players. It does require a bit of patience and concentration though, unless you just want to breeze through with the hint system. If you enjoy this kind of gameplay you're in luck, as it seems there's dozens of them available on Steam, but I didn't get much enjoyment out of it.

review: Allein dass das Spiel so schÃ¶ne MÃ¤rchencharakteren und wunderschÃ¶ne traumhafte Orte bietet,macht es fÃ¼r mich zu einem liebgewonnenen Zeitvertreib.Ich finde es toll,das es so mystisch ist, so versetzt es mich in meine Kindheit zurÃ¼ck .Es bringt Spass die Geheimnisse und Aufgaben zu lÃ¶sen, ich kann nichts negatives sagen. weiter so !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035835415', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1507636313}
review:
Ein schÃ¶nes Spiel mit einer mÃ¤rchenhaften AtmosphÃ¤re. Wer es lieber ruhiger mag und keine anspruchsvollen RÃ¤tsel erwartet, fÃ¼r Denjenigen ist dieses Spiel genau das Richtige. Die Wimmelbilder sind wunderschÃ¶n und die Story kurz und knackig. Ab und an hatte ich Probleme, bestimmte GegenstÃ¤nde zu finden, weil sie sehr gut versteckt sind, jedoch ist das gar nicht so schlimm. Die Minispiele sind dagegen sehr leicht. Nebenbei kannst du dich durch die malerische Gegend durchklicken und Karten oder Blumen sammeln.

Kann die negative Bewertung teilweise gar nicht nachvollziehen. Nicht jedes Wimmelbild muss einen herausfordern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015324296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1507228532}
review:
Definitely a good and casual HOS game. Fairy and magic atmosphere and characters, well rendered by a vast majority of beautiful graphics. 
Puzzles (mini games) and HO scenes intertwine well along a good enough story. Mini games are fairly easy. The game in itself is quite easy too, but enjoyable. The pace of the game is ok for casual gamers.  
Achievements are not difficult to get. Sadly, the game is a bit short. For that reason I'd only get it on sale. 
A nice game, that Artifex fans could appreciate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078882224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1503956892}
review:
I have never thought that I will hate this game as much as I do. I played a few Artifex Mundi games and while they were never that great they were still enjoyable. This one is not only much too easy to the point that it is almost insulting to the player, it has also little to no sense. It looks like I could finish the game while I was just using the random items. 

But the worst are all the Slavic references. First of all, we are constantly reminded that it is about Slavic. "There is a piece of paper let's write down "Slavic" for no reason."

The sadest thing is that even though the Artifex Mundi is a Polish company (so they are Slavic) it looks like they did no reseach at all. I am no expert about slavic tales but I am pretty sure that I would hear something about a talking squirrel that is very important in that game for some unknown reason. 

In conlusion, I do not recomend this game for anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060863711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1501102556}
review:
I always thought point and click games weren't any fun. Played one many, many years ago and since then have always avoided them. But, now that I can't play most games due to a cast for boxer's fracture, I decided to buy this, since it was very cheap on sale anyway. Count me surprised! This turned out to be a really cool adventure. It has beautifull graphics with animations and video's, nice puzzle solving etc.. It's a high quality work and really fun to play too. It has actually gotten me into a genre I always thought was boring hehe. Immediately bought another one from Artifex Mundi aswell.

Definitely recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971047607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1500519537}
review:
A well presented Hidden Object game with beautiful artwork and graphics, strong voice acting, a bonus chapter, decent length, interesting HO scenes and a Slavic fairy tale setting that is fresh.

The only negatives I have are that occasionally the object needed to advance and where it interacted with was unclear or didn't make sense, and the story is the typical "rescue a loved one while there are supernatural forces at play" plot the HO games rarely stray from.

Overall, it held my interest to the end, and the presentation is excellent. HO fans won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127831772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1500484411}
review: Nice and easy puzzle game, quite good if you're just looking for a casual game

author: {'steamid': '76561197986416959', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1500510577}
review: A very calming and relaxing game, the world was very soothing. The puzzles weren't overly difficult and you also had the option to use hints and even skips if puzzles became too frustrating (at least on the lower difficulties) which I personally liked, I play these types of games as stress relievers and sometimes they can get overly fiddly but that wasn't the case here. The audio helped set the tone, with the music being very calming throughout, although I did experience some audio popping here and there which was a shame. The voice acting and story were serviceable, don't expect too much but what's there is cute and adds something to the game so you're not just randomly solving puzzles for no reason. Overall it's a good point and click game that I'm happy to recommend to fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080370930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1499776851}
review:
Typical HOG, well made, flowing game play, lovely artwork, non intrusive soundtrack, and easy to follow story. Worht paying full price, but always better if you can pick it up in the sale.
Basically what you'd expect from Artifex Mundi, some other developers/publishers need to be taking notes.

It has everything you need;

Map
Fast travel
trading cards
Acheivements
Working hint button
A good walkthrough available on line (though you really shouldn't need it).

If I have one minor grumble, it's that some of the puzzles were a little too easy.

Rating                      90/100
Replay value           2/10 (only to pick up a missed acheivement)
Play time approx     4-5 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561197972822414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1498940390}
review: A decent enough hidden object game. After playing so many of these I don't know what else to say really. The story is entertaining, the art work is good and the puzzles are simple casual fun. Just what you are looking for in this type of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1498529007}
review:
https://youtu.be/UxC_rURI1Is

There are crimes and mysteries only a botanist can solve and Eve Ntide is the right woman for the job.  Tracking down a critic message from her estranged grandmother, Eve finds her self in a world outside her wildest imaginations.

Being a casual hidden object game does limit the range of challenge that it can provide to players, Eventide walks the line well enough by presenting puzzles that may be easy but don't feel insultingly so.

review:

Nie wiedziaÅ‚am, czy siÄ™ Å›miaÄ‡, czy pÅ‚akaÄ‡, gdy po raz pierwszy zobaczyÅ‚am, jak sylwetka i twarz bohatera, zamiast dorysowanych rÄ™cznie kolejnych klatek, wydÅ‚uÅ¼a siÄ™ i wygina, symulujÄ…c ruch i mimikÄ™.

Staram siÄ™ jednak przymykaÄ‡ na to oko, bo wydaje mi siÄ™, Å¼e gra jest kierowana raczej do dzieci. Ale tu pojawia siÄ™ mÃ³j kolejny zarzut - brak aspektu edukacyjnego. Nie oczekiwaÅ‚abym go, gdyby nie to, Å¼e gra, poczÄ…wszy od swojego tytuÅ‚u po fakt, Å¼e rozgrywa siÄ™ w skansenie/muzeum mitologii sÅ‚owiaÅ„skiej, aÅ¼ krzyczy, jak bardzo jest sÅ‚owiaÅ„ska. I byÅ‚am przekonana, Å¼e rzeczywiÅ›cie dowiem siÄ™ z niej czegoÅ› na temat sÅ‚owiaÅ„skich wierzeÅ„. Niestety, chociaÅ¼ znalazÅ‚y siÄ™ tu tradycyjne chaty, uroki, runy i kwiat paproci, temat zostaÅ‚ potraktowany pobieÅ¼nie i osoba, ktÃ³ra nie jest z nim obeznana, wiele siÄ™ nie nauczy.

Jednak gdyby wszystkie powyÅ¼sze zarzuty potraktowaÄ‡ z przymruÅ¼eniem oka i skupiÄ‡ siÄ™ na rozgrywce, gra siÄ™ broni. Ledwo, ale jednak siÄ™ broni. Gry hidden object, w jakie zdarzaÅ‚o mi siÄ™ dotychczas graÄ‡, gameplayowo ograniczaÅ‚y siÄ™ wyÅ‚Ä…cznie do wypeÅ‚nionych szczegÃ³Å‚ami plansz z przedmiotami do znalezienia, jednak w Eventide wypatrywanie przedmiotÃ³w na obrazkach byÅ‚o tylko jednym z elementÃ³w, tak jak Å‚amigÅ‚Ã³wki logiczne, a caÅ‚oÅ›Ä‡ zaklasyfikowaÅ‚abym raczej jako point-and-click. GÅ‚Ã³wne zadanie gracza opisaÅ‚abym jako chodzenie od lokacji do lokacji w poszukiwaniu miejsc, w ktÃ³rych wymagany jest jakiÅ› przedmiot lub element ukÅ‚adanki, a nastÄ™pnie stopniowe znajdowanie tych przedmiotÃ³w i otwieranie dostÄ™pu do kolejnych miejsc. Jest to przyjemny proces, chociaÅ¼ ma teÅ¼ swojÄ… wadÄ™ - czasem potrzebne przedmioty oraz miejsca, w ktÃ³rych naleÅ¼aÅ‚o ich uÅ¼yÄ‡, byÅ‚y tak od siebie oddalone, Å¼e zdÄ…Å¼yÅ‚am juÅ¼ zapomnieÄ‡, do czego wÅ‚aÅ›ciwie dany przedmiot byÅ‚ mi potrzebny i gdzie powinnam go uÅ¼yÄ‡. Gra cierpi teÅ¼ oczywiÅ›cie na typowe problemy point-and-clickÃ³w - dlaczego bohaterka nie moÅ¼e po prostu odgarnÄ…Ä‡ pajÄ™czyny rÄ™kÄ…, zamiast konstruowaÄ‡ mioteÅ‚kÄ™, itp.

MajÄ…c zero-jedynkowy wybÃ³r polecenia gry lub jej odradzenia, decydujÄ™ siÄ™ na polecenie. JeÅ›li nie macie duÅ¼ych oczekiwaÅ„ (a ja, przyznam, miaÅ‚am zerowe oczekiwania, dostajÄ…c do rÄ…k plik darmowych kodÃ³w na prawie wszystkie gry stworzone/wydane przez Artifex Mundi) i jesteÅ›cie w stanie Å›miaÄ‡ siÄ™ z niedociÄ…gniÄ™Ä‡, bÄ™dziecie w stanie doceniÄ‡ tÄ™ przyjemnÄ…, choÄ‡ bardzo przeciÄ™tnÄ… produkcjÄ™.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074298261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1492887943}
review:
It's not often you encounter a game so bad it truly makes you angry, but this one does, and the fact that this shameful piece of rubbish came from Artifex Mundi just makes it worse. This game assumes you are a particularly untalented (possibly lobotomized) chimpanzee with learning difficulties, and even if you are, you will still be flying through the game with zero resistance. I am not exaggerating when I say this: [b]Every puzzle could easily be replaced with a big [i]â€NEXTâ€[/i] button, without affecting game difficulty in any relevant manner.[/b] Yes, it's literally that easy.  
 
This game is an insult to human intellect.

review: I really enjoyed the story of Eventide, everything linked in and made complete sense by the end so I can really recommend you hold out until that final scene because it clears up a lot! author: {'steamid': '76561198083289730', 'num_games_owned': 1424, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1494153358}
review: Decent point and click with a nice story line (ah well it is entertaining anyway), nice graphics and a lot of traveling. The navigate map function is a bit rough (it puts you somewhere near where you are suppose to be but it might be a few screen ahead or back as well). Recommended for an hour of more of fun, the story is not too long but long enough...

author: {'steamid': '76561197972999224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1493494385}
review: This was a good one. How often do you see stories about slavic mythos let alone in a HOG. My one problem is some of the puzzles or items are not as intuitive as they could be. Like Magnet that you need to extend the range of and a rope. Use the rope on the magnet? Nope. Use the rope on a door in the same room to open the latch. (You'll see, it makes sense.) The actual item to go with the magnet is a string on a stick. Other then that this was a nice change of atmosphere. Kind of reminded me a little of Enigmatis 2 with the abandoned theme park.

review:
[h1]Eventide : Slavic Fable[/h1]

Jeu dâ€™aventure, objets cachÃ©s inspirÃ© de la mythologie slave, Â« Eventide : Slavic Fable Â» qui mâ€™a Ã©tÃ© gracieusement offert ! Câ€™est mon premier Artifex Mundi donc je nâ€™ai pas de point de comparaison mais mon avis est assez partagÃ©. 
Certes le cÃ´tÃ© visuel, sonore, les nombreuses crÃ©atures rencontrÃ©es ainsi que les nombreux jeux et Ã©nigmes ont tout pour sÃ©duire mais lâ€™histoire de fond mâ€™a laissÃ© sur ma faim. Elle est trÃ¨s courte, sans rebondissement et laisse peu de chance de sâ€™attacher aux personnages. Câ€™est la premiÃ¨re fois que lâ€™envie de rÃ©soudre dâ€™autres Ã©nigmes et mini-jeux me motivent dâ€™avantage que lâ€™envie de connaÃ®tre la suite de lâ€™histoire. NÃ©anmoins les Ã©nigmes bien que faciles, sont plutÃ´t bien ficelÃ©es et on passe quelques heures agrÃ©ables Ã  les rÃ©soudre.   

 [h1]En conclusion : [/h1]
Â« Eventide : Slavic Fable Â», un jeu dâ€™Ã©nigmes, dâ€™objets cachÃ©s court et facile, qui vous divertira agrÃ©ablement pendant quelques heures mais ne laissera pas une empreinte indÃ©lÃ©bile dans vos esprits. Je recommande plutÃ´t en solde.  

[b]Bilan : 6/10[/b]

[h1]English summary : [/h1]
Â« Eventide : Slavic Fable Â» is a short and easy hidden objetâ€™s game with many puzzle and mini-games. It will entertain you few hours but probably wonâ€™t be able to create a lasting impression on you. I recommend it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031213600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1662216756}
review:
SchÃ¶ne Musik und Szenerien. Unterhaltsame Minispiele und Wimmelbilder. Wenn man mal etwas ruhiges zum Nachdenken spielen mÃ¶chte, ist das denke ich ganz gut geeignet.
Hab' die erste Geschichte in etwa 6 Stunden in mittlerer Schwierigkeit mit nur wenigen Tipps durchgespielt.
Die Bonusgeschichte habe ich in 40 Minuten geschafft.
Die Musik gefiel mir so gut, dass ich mir die Lieder abgespeichert habe. (Ãœbrigens tolles Feature von den Entiwcklern)
Habe das Spiel in einem Random Key Pack fÃ¼r knapp Ã¼ber einen Euro bekommen mit mehreren anderen Wimmelbildspielen von Artifex Mundi. FÃ¼r den Preis kann man sich nicht beklagen. :D
FÃ¼r Vollpreis wÃ¼rde ich mir solche Spiele aber glaube ich nicht kaufen, es sei denn, Grafiken und Musik wÃ¤ren in viel hÃ¶herer QualitÃ¤t und die Stories und Spielverlauf komplexer und nicht-linear.

review:
Bonjour a tous.

Concernant Eventide: Slavic Fable :

TrÃ¨s bon Artifex, une bonne histoire qui nous met bien dans l'ambiance, des scÃ¨nes d'objets cachÃ©s travaillÃ©es, de mÃªme pour les puzzles mÃªme si dans l'ensemble je les es trouvÃ©s "classiques". On a aussi toujours les fameux items cachÃ©s Ã  trouver et Ã§a on aime bien hÃ©hÃ©. Et une petite histoire en plus a debloquer quand on fini le jeu.

Graphiquement pas vilain du tout, trÃ¨s colorÃ© et des animations de bonne qualitÃ©.

Des musiques superbes ce qui est assez rare car souvent trÃ¨s banales, ici je les es trouvÃ©s vraiment bien.

Donc tout ce qu'il faut pour que Eventide: Slavic Fable soit un bon jeu avec une durÃ©e de vie correct, il a grandement ca place dans la collection Artifex.

A conseiller a tous, aux experts comme aux dÃ©butants pas de soucis, n'hÃ©sitez pas un bon moment vous attends !

Sur ce bon jeu a tous !

author: {'steamid': '76561197972416553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1485021477}
review:
Artifex Mundi are really hitting their stride now, and are clearly the kings of the HOBO market. The graphics are always massively saturated, colourful and inspired, and the voice acting is more than acceptable for games of this sort. No, the puzzles aren't going to challenge you too much, but they're all logical and fair which I like. Probably could have done with a couple of extra HOBO scenes, they were a bit sparse and a little too easy, but still good fun to be had and the polish is increasing with every title. Bad transalations are almost non existent now, thank god!

Definitely a thumbs up for people who are a fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227942340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1483624115}
review:
The game does not differ much from other Artifex Mundi games. The graphic is pretty, music is pleasant, and puzzles are not very difficult. I loved the Slavic folklore, so good to finally have something familiar and close instead of magic, which is usually the main part of each hopa game. 
The only negative thing, it is short. I have finished the whole game + extra chapter within 3.5h and I was taking my time.
Worth playing, but because of the length I would advise waiting for steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068842575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1482129065}
review:
I enjoyed the game I just wish the story was stronger personally.  Artifex Mundi's side characters and villains used to be far more memorable and it seems they are just meh now. Still it's a fun game, runs well, has nice music and art. So I can't bash it too much. It's a little overpriced right now, but that's most  Artifex Mundi games when they first hit steam. I'd suggest waiting for a steam sale and then pick this up. 

All in all I'd say: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198092065417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1523621012}
review:
Pros:

Cute story
Lots of eye candy
Lovely music loop
Voices for the most part aren't bad

Cons:

Short
Extra story incredibly short, shorter than usual for an extra chapter in an Artifex Mundi game
Ending line in extra chapter feels forced...done just to link extra chapter to main game

Verdict:
Cute but short, somewhat visually stimulating.  Buy it when it's cheap or part of a bundle.  A decent quality but short title published by Artifex Mundi, one of the more prolific professional HOG purveyors on Steam.

review:
Ya he jugado muchos juegos de esta desarrolladora y la verdad cada uno me va descepcionando mas uno tras otro... es el hecho que mezclan modos de juego tan pobres y mal implementados que es mas desesperante no por su complejidad sino por su sin sentido... no encajan en la trama ni nada... ahora si nos vamos al sentido comun para superar los acertijos, no tengo palabras para describirlos, no se que tipo de mentalidad tenian los desarrolladores o los de pruebas o el de produccion; se siente tremendamente forzado el avance y a veces hasta estupida la manera de resolverlo.
La verdad lo jugue porque lo compre del humble bundle y este ha sido por mucho el PEOR de todos.
Y si despues de leer esto lo compraras y jugaras, da click a lo pendejo por todos lados y usa todos los items, luego riete de como rompes un piedra con un pedazo de una bicicleta... pero no con una pala o un pico minero... o romper un vidrio con un anillo... pero no puedes usar un piedra, o el pico minero, o el tubo de bici, o una pala... No, tiene que ser con el puto anillo... por dios

review: This game was definitely fun to play.  I love casual HOG adventures and this one did not disappoint. The hidden object scenes were good and the puzzles were fun. It only took me about 3 hours to complete, so if you are looking for something that takes longer, this may not be the one for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189516483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1478788262}
review: As I am a constant player of this kind of games since I've discovered the genre long time ago, I'm now searching and enjoying three things during the action play : storyline, graphic concept and puzzle dificulty.For the first two subjects Eventide can easly get a ten.For the puzzle dificulty level I can say that it is a "sunday afternoon" game and can be easily played on hard mode with a 100% achievements gained in 3-4 hours by anyone.Overall yes, I recommend and I will for sure play the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007312632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1478198136}
review: Very interesting plot.  For a fairytale game it covers the territory with beauty and amazing graphics.  The bad guy was obvious to the little girl;  she forgot her instincts as she grew up and the story had a launching point.  The bond between the young woman and her grandmother was believable.  One complaint is that the grandmother is that she did not take caare of her appearance.  I have been taught as a registered nurse that if I do not take care of myself I will not be able to properly take of the people I am caring for.  I guess that was the point because she was kidnapped and tortured.  Anyway, I enjoyed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094632071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1478118566}
review:
I am currently on a point and click games train where I am playing through a lot of them. Decided to write a review for one of them. So... If you enjoy point and click games this is good I guess. The thing that I do want to mention is writing. I found it abysmal. Every other sentence has to have word "slavic" in it. It is just so bad. My ears hurt every time I heard it. 

If this is story about slavic creatures, we can assume it is taking place in a slavic country. Now why would people from that country feel the need to mention word "slavic" so often. They wouldn't say "Those are creatures from slavic myths" they would just say "Those are creatures from myths". 

In the end no one will probably see this, but if you do, remember this is a game about slavic creatures, game sure won't let you forget that. 

Also there is one moment in a game that just made no sense. I know that point and click games, let's say, aren't always logical, but still. 
[spoiler]So at one poing you need to defeat flying monster. You are told to talk to the guy who did that before. When you talk to him however, he says that his body is in pain and he needs a bath to bring back his power. "Okay", I thought, "I will run him a bath and he will fight the monster with me", but no! After going through a lot of pointing and clicking he takes the bath. Once he is out, he thanks you and gives you a key to a tool used to defeat the monster! Just put it into perspective. I am on a mission to save all of the creatures including him, but instead of giving me the key he decided he wants to have a bath first![/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198053227328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1477811876}
review: easy

author: {'steamid': '76561198090366497', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1477434449}
review:
A lovely example of this genre. Despite the impending doom it plays at a very relaxed pace with a nice mix of (easy) puzzles, hidden object scenes and basic point n click elements. Some of the dialog is a little ropey but the story plays out nicely and there is a bonus (prequel) chapter once you are finished with the main story.

There is a sort of free play on the hidden object scenes available in the extras section and I do recommend looking at the beastiary cards you collect which detail various inhabitants from this mythology.

Very much enjoyed working my way through this one, so I would recommend it if you enjoy games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027424772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1520554640}
review:
[b][u]Game Information[/u][/b]

"Eventide: Slavic Fable"  is a Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game. The game was developed by The House of Fables and published by Artifex Mundi.

"Slavic Fable" is the first episode of "Eventide."

Even though the game is not labelled as a collector's edition, it has some extra features that are not available in its' counterpart; the standard edition.

[b][u]The Game Review[/u][/b]

Game Visuals

I want to mention that the visuals in the game are nicely done. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mention that audio for the game is well done. Even though the audio is somewhat simplistic and repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keeps track of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly without having the need to constantly backtrack. It also indicates that there are a variety of tasks that can be completed at various locations within the game. The interactive map is not automatically given at the start of the game. It also has a unique feature: the map can be flipped over to the other side.

There is no padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place. The inventory panel comes automatically stationary.

The hidden object scenes consist of the following: Find "x" amount; Fragmented items and Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interaction. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them.

There are two collectibles in the game: Ethereal Flowers and Bestiary Cards. They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find.

There are twenty-five different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that need to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Since this is a collector's edition, there is a bonus chapter, but it can be accessed only after the main story is completed.

Miscellaneous

There are extra features in the game: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Wallpapers; Concept Art and Soundtracks. Most of these extra features can be accessed only after the entire game is completed.

There are five different trading cards to collect. Only three of those trading cards are given out by the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to a certain extent. The replay value for the game is low. I would recommend this game, but not at the game's full price value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067370258', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1459706886}
review:

+ pretty graphics,
+ nice music,
+ easy puzzles (but not too easy),
+ normal playtime for HOG (3.2 hours with bonus chapter on expert difficulty)

- bit boring story

It's a really decent HOG, would recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1476016682}
review:
[h1]A Point & Click Adventure[/h1]
https://youtu.be/Z5ndcG8ZsQA
+ The gameplay is pretty straightforward consisting mostly of light puzzles and finding various objects to pass an obstacle or progress the story.
+ Beautiful backgrounds. Very colorful and detailed
+ Lots of animations in every scene that really brings the world to life
+ Great voice acting which matches the characters very well
+ Surprisingly realistic characters with animated facial expressions and mouth movements that sync with their voice which is very rare to find in Point & Click adventures. 
+ Personally, I'm not a big Point & Click fan because many games are overly difficult and require you to almost always use a guide. This game seems to be more casual while also giving you plenty of hints and/or skips if you feel like you are having a hard time.
+ Great soundtrack

author: {'steamid': '76561197986997483', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 314, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1476003301}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035226423', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1474821670}
review: Nive passtime

author: {'steamid': '76561198032800685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1474647920}
review: Usually HOGs that Artifex Mundi commissions to smaller software houses aren't very good, but this one is a gem. Good graphics and cutscenes, interesting story, achievements, cards and a bonus chapter after the main game. HO scenes and minigames are well done but fewer than usual and the game is on the short side if you're an expert player, however it was a pleasant experience and I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012902673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1486229199}
review: The puzzles here are usually intuitive. The background art inthis game is gorgeous as well, although the characters look odd and the story is nothing to write home about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060841177', 'num_games_owned': 4733, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1474648028}
review: This game is great. Clever and beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325709043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1474325868}
review: This game is unlike any other hidden object games I have played, which is refreshing. The artwork is lovely, and the music has not grown at all tiresome. If you have played a lot of hidden object games and want something with a different twist to the story, this one is excellent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198166379868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1546122544}
review:
C'est vÃ©ritablement un de mes jeux prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©s d'Artifex Mundi, l'ambiance fantasy slave est vraiment gÃ©niale, j'ai dÃ©couvert quelques crÃ©atures (mais bon, il est vrai que je ne suis pas calÃ©e en mythologie slave et c'est un tort). Donc, pour le coup, qu'est-ce qu'il vaut ce petit jeu ?
Eh bien, pas mal du tout:
 - l'animation a quelques mauvais traits (Ã  une ou deux reprises) mais rien d'horripilant non plus, c'est largement passable,
 - ensuite l'histoire, eh bien elle est plutÃ´t prenante, et personnellement elle m'a beaucoup plu,
 - les jeux, plutÃ´t divers et variÃ©s certains sont assez difficiles et d'autres d'une facilitÃ© dÃ©concertante mais il y a au moins du niveau,
 - la durÃ©e de vie est bonne, comptez bien 5 heures de jeu, plus si vous voulez tous les trophÃ©es comme moi (faire le jeu en mode expert, essayer d'attraper tous les objets cachÃ©s...)

Conclusion : un excellent jeu d'Artifex Mundi, juste une question: Ã  quand la suite ? :p

author: {'steamid': '76561198317528149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1478080891}
review: j'aime ce jeu dans son ensemble. A quand la suite ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198074310107', 'num_games_owned': 3073, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1472989527}
review:
Nothing unusual from Artifex Mundi here. Usual graphics, usual puzzles - a decent HO game. Having in mind that these aspects are always coming great from Artifex Mundi, I must say the story was pretty shallow and boring, which was a big drawback here.
Better get Grim Legends :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198247984964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1472856427}
review: I played this game after completing the Enigmatis and Grim Legends series. While I didn't feel this game was as strong as those, I really enjoyed it and thought the art was beautiful. Another solid game from Artifex Mundi!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988271944', 'num_games_owned': 1346, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1472406033}
review:
Devo dire che la Artifex ha fatto giochi migliori.

Questo loro prodotto mi Ã¨ piaciuto molto meno rispetto ad altri. Mi Ã¨ parso troppo semplice. 

Ovviamente rimane sempre un prodotto di nicchia, mirato per quegli amanti dei punta e clicca ma il tocco "Artifex" rimane sempre. Consigliato scontato o da bundle.

Voto 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961256731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 442, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1558736454}
review:
a very short but decent HOG from Artifex Mundi which is a guarantee for high quality HOG.

pros.
high resolution.
good sound tracks.
decent story.
great graphics.

cons.
very very short. main story= less than two and half hours. bonus story = around half hour.
WAY TOO EASY.


for hardcore HOG fans is a should buy. but definatly not for the full price. that price for the length of the gameplay time is not fair. 

I highly recommend that game on sale or from a bundle.

i give the game 7/10 due to the short time of gameplay +1 for cards =8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198317858314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2727, 'last_played': 1517436678}
review: Decent game--would have liked to have to found more hidden objects. A good game,  Just needed more spice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002506911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1468692339}
review: It's time to save Grandma from the clutches of evil.  This follows the typical greatness that Artifex Mundi offers in all of its hidden object games.  The graphics are great, the storyline is unnecessary, the voice acting is mediocre, but the fun of the puzzles and hidden object games are great.  This game was short and fairly easy.  I found the hidden object scenes weren't as typical as you would expect, while some were tough.  The atypical HOS were find an object, place it where it fits, which gives you another object and then find where that goes, and so on and so forth.  It was a good break from the typical HOS, but felt too easy.  The puzzles were good, but nothing extravagant that made it too difficult to move forward.  As usual easy achievements for those hunters out there.  Definitely recommend it if you love these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088233033', 'num_games_owned': 1832, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1479936004}
review: I love the fantasy figures. The story I think is not so good as the fantasy figures self. When I look at the figures and how the game looks I expected more of the story it self. But so as I sad previously I love the fantasy figures so that't making a lot (for me) good. One thing I  don't like: for the achievemenst to get al cards, there is one card that you don't get anymore after you went through the labyrinth. So you have one opportunity to get it and you go really fast past it without noticed it. You have to play the game again to get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088679718', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1461434043}
review:
â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜†â˜†â˜†

OK, I must confess I just love that little HOPA games from Artifex Mundi. If you're looking for chilling, point&click adventure, [b]Eventide: Slavic Fable[/b] is good choice. If you've played AM games, you know what to expect - incredible HDR-like graphics (just look on the screenshots), pleasant music, simple story and easy mechanics. A distinctive element of this particular game is the main theme - Slavic tales, however I expected something a bit deeper and less infantile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2325, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1467808391}
review:
As per usual, Artifex Mundi put out another high quality hidden object game. Game takes about 2 hours or so.

Graphically its not bad. Animations arent that great, but the backgrounds and still shots are beautiful (as you can see from the store page screenshots). Audio was pretty good. Music got a little old after awhile, but the sound effects were nice. Voice acting was better than Im used to from a hidden object game, which was a nice surprise. 

Puzzles were your standard issue hidden object game puzzles. None of them were overly difficult, and if youve played other hidden object games, then youll recognize some repeated puzzle styles. 

Where this game really shined for me, was the story. Slavic folklore is a pretty interesting topic for a story (in my opinion anyway), and I felt they did a pretty good job incorporating it into a lighter-hearted video game.  Without spoiling too much, the game had a cool side achievement for collecting these lore cards that were pretty cool reads if you wanted even more insight into the creatures in the lore, as well as some of the characters you meet. That said, the story still follows the "person gets kidnapped, you must rescue said person" plot line that crops up pretty often in these.  May or may not be a deal breaker for some if theyre looking for something new.

The only bugs I found were when I was doing a speed playthrough to complete an achievement I missed. If I cleared an area too quickly (picked up all the objects rapidly), the game wouldnt recognize that it was cleared and would let me keep opening that spot. Example off the top of my head being the crawfish cage and the toolbox in the boat house. When I played normally (and not spam clicking through), the game was perfect.

Overall, the puzzles were a bit same-y, but if youre into fantasy or folklore at all, the story was more than interesting enough to give this a big recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314715511', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1467456761}
review:
Just started to play hidden object games and this is my 4th game. With great graphics and 3D models, rich of collective items and really not so hard to get all of them without any tips. Even like me not very good at puzzle game, the main story can be played without using any hints. (the Casual difficulty) There are total 23 mini games, they will obviously take some time to solve but it is a big fun to play with. Also, the main purpose is clear and story runs smooth. I love those 30 cards which introduce 30 kinds of the mysterious creatures. Especially the sub chara is very adorable, good to see such character appears in game.

The additional story is a nice epsiode for player to enjoy the fern flower story in another character's view. I hope to play another game produced by Artifex Mundi, maybe Nightmares from the Deep will be my next choice ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1461498121}
review:
[h1]Short version: 82%[/h1]
Eventide is a typical craftsmen work of a hidden object game. It uses well-known mechanics and story type (granddaughter saving grandma and cute creatures from evil demon), but it knows how to use them well.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
One of the banes of hidden object games is that they all can feel relatively the same. For example, if you think about a typical modern HOG with all of the usual HOG elements, you think about a game like Eventide: Slavic Fable.

Not that itâ€™s a bad thing; Eventide knows its trade well. With its great graphics and enjoyable hidden/fragmented object scenes, there isnâ€™t much that can be said against it. Well, okay, the map system is barely useful and it really needs more puzzles over the point â€˜nâ€™ click style item management. 

The story also likes to stay on known waters: our heroine has to go on a journey to save her grandmother from the clutches of an evil Slavic half-demon, and to do so, she gets help from other Slavic creatures. By the way, the game really wants to remind everyone that it is about Slavic folklore. Maybe a little too muchâ€¦

author: {'steamid': '76561198145379093', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1465538792}
review:
Das Wimmelbildspiel hat mir sehr gut gefallen.
Man taucht in eine mÃ¤rchenhafte AtmosphÃ¤re ab und klickt sich durch die Story; ein Bonuskapitel ist ebenfalls enthalten. Grafik ist fÃ¼r ein HOG gut, sehr liebevoll gestaltet. Die Wimmelbilder und RÃ¤tsel waren nach meinem Empfinden eher einfach. Die Musik ist schÃ¶n, passend zur AtmosphÃ¤re sehr sanft und gut zum Entspannen.
Errungenschaften sind leicht mit 100% zu erreichen, es genÃ¼gt auch ein Spieldurchlauf fÃ¼r 100%. 
Sammelkarten gibt es ebenfalls.
Wer gerne solche Spiele spielt, sollte dieses nicht auslassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163926961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1466014049}
review: Akcja "Eventide: SÅ‚owiaÅ„skiej baÅ›ni" toczy siÄ™ w parku, swoistym rezerwacie, ktÃ³ry prowadzi babcia "gÅ‚Ã³wnej bohaterki". Å»yjÄ… tam sobie spokojnie stworki znane z baÅ›ni i legend, ktÃ³re pomagajÄ… w prowadzeniu osady, ale ta sielanka nie podoba siÄ™ panu pobliskiego zamku - Borucie, ktÃ³ry porywa babciÄ™ i pragnie poznaÄ‡ tajemnicÄ™ magicznego kwiatu paproci. Tak mniej wiÄ™cej przedstawia siÄ™ fabuÅ‚a gry od Artifex Mundi, w ktÃ³rej jak zwykle, oprÃ³cz ciekawej historii, moÅ¼emy znaleÅºÄ‡ klimatycznÄ… muzykÄ™ i Å›licznÄ… grafikÄ™. Zagadki i scenki HO nie sÄ… za trudne, ale przyznam, Å¼e zdenerwowaÅ‚a mnie zagadka oddzielania od siebie pÅ‚ywajÄ…cych elementÃ³w ;) Gra jest godna polecenia, szczegÃ³lnie dla miÅ‚oÅ›nikÃ³w gier typu HO :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198306050568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1465916416}
review:
First time I have played a whole game by myself. It was fairly easy to navigate, but I had to ask for hints occassionally. Once completed it unloked a secondary game, which was very rewarding.
If you like point and click puzzle games, it is a good choice.
I was surprised how many times I had to go back to a scene already investigated , and solved, to find that it had another task to complete.

review: This is a nice little puzzler set in a world where Slavic myths are still alive and well and sustained by magic and human faith. The setting is refreshing in its subject matter and it was nice to explore a location completely centered around a mythology that doesn't get used very often.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230021992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1497216263}
review:
Ein sehr wunderschÃ¶nes Point&Click Abenteuer. Die Musik ist sehr melodisch und beruhigend. Die Animationen sind sehr detailreich und mit viel Liebe gestaltet. Die meisten Mini-Spiele sind altbekannt und doch unterscheiden sie sich von anderen Spielen von Artifex Mundi im Detail. DafÃ¼r sind die Point&Click RÃ¤tsel teilweise oft sehr anspruchsvoll im positiven Sinne. Die Charaktere sind sympathisch und man findet sich gleich von Anfang an mitten drin in einer Welt voller Fabeln und Mythen. Auch die Video-Szenen sind traumhaft schÃ¶n!
Dieses Spiel ist wirklich sehr gelungen! Wer Phantasie, Point&Click und Wimmelbild mag, sollte sich dieses Spiel wirklich nicht entgehen lassen! Auch fÃ¼r Liebhaber von "Grimmige Legenden" ist Eventide wirklich ideal :)
Ich hoffe sehr auf Eventide 2 ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198018649889', 'num_games_owned': 789, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1461743183}
review:
This game is one of the best hidden object game I've played so far.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Great graphics.
[*]Fantastic music. It's very soothing and incredibly pleasant to listen to.
[*]Good user interface.
[*]Quick travel makes navigation really great.
[*]This game is fairly long (for the genre). The bonus chapter is short but nice.
[*]Good variety of puzzles.
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]The puzzles are nice, but they are way too easy to pose any challenge.
[/list]

If you've never played a hidden object game, try this.
If you don't like this game, then this genre is not for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110483386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1461005270}
review: I enjoyed this one more than any other HO game so far. There are different types of puzzles and HO scenes, so it doesn't get too repetitive, which is so often the case (and then I start using hints and skipping puzzles). This is also the first HO game in which I did not use any hints in the HO scenes and didn't skip any puzzles. The difficulty level was just right, so those didn't get frustrating. The story is interesting enough and I liked the graphics, especially the different creatures in the Moorland park. Finding the collectables wasn't too hard, although I managed to miss a few of the cards. I'm looking forward to the second part, which I will buy when it becomes available.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194289627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1667993709}
review:
(Note: my "play time" in Steam is under-stated because i played through this on Android, not Steam.)

Eventide is every bit as good as Enigmatis 2, if not better, and the theme likely has a wider appeal (while also being 100% family-friendly, unlike Enigmatis 2). It's possibly not as engrossing, as it's missing the "investigation chart" from Enigmatis 2, but it nonetheless sports the same production quality. The activation zones in the puzzle involving several wooden figures are "way off" (tried 3 times without success before Hint told me that it was indeed possible), but the rest is excellent - graphics, audio, pacing, characters, object interaction. Eventide and Enigmatis 2 easily set a new standard for Artifex Mundi quality, and i hope they make more titles like these, rather than more like their Time-traveler series.

If every HOPA were as well-made as this one, the world would be a happier place. i simply can't say enough good things about Eventide.
